review.title: Dark and noisy
review.reviewText:
The hotel diva is not our style. It is very modern and very dark. The room was clean and decently sized. But my overall impression is that the hotel was dark and dungeonous.

The hotel is currently going through renovations. The fitness center is closed (they partnered with a gym around the corner) and construction picked up at 7:00 am on Sunday morning. For this, they charged a $15 resort fee.  Hotel Diva is a far cry from a resort.

On the plus side, location was good and the adjoining Mexican restaurant was delicious.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review us.  We apologize about the elevator delays and will discuss this with our team to help us improve the speed.  Thank you again, we wish your stay would have been more enjoyable.

review.title: Hotel is under construction. Was not disclosed
review.reviewText: Only one elevator and the construction crew used the same one. As a result it took upwards of 15 minutes to get an elevator.

review.title: Wasnt told it was under construction
review.reviewText: Good service till checking in later the guy up front was slow and rude

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and clean place shopping dining with walking distance I always love San Francisco and I really like this place first time I got a good impression totally recommend this place

review.title: Convenient location, near great restaurants
review.reviewText: The hotel was under construction, plastic tarps draped all over the floor we stayed on  It looked better in the photos that in person.  The hotel staff was wonderful.

review.title: Construction
review.reviewText: Too much construction, elevators and hallway looked like Dexter's Kill Room.  Window looked onto a brick wall.  Felt like my first NYC apartment!
review.positiveRemarks: Room was dark, mostly quiet (until the morning construction) Comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: room needed updating
review.locationRemarks: Near the Westin, who had free wifi in their lobby.  Hung out there while waiting for room to be ready.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing this unfortunate experience with us.  I am pleased to hear you loved our location, however I apologize that the rest of your stay was not more enjoyable.  I will speak with my front desk team in regards to the feedback.  I will also make sure we are posting correct information about the upgrades taking place.  We appreciate you letting us know and hope to have the chance to impress you on a future stay.

review.title: Not great
review.reviewText: I will start out with the good things first - location. I enjoyed the location next to Union Square and close to Market Street. Tons of shops and hole in the wall restaurants San Fran is known for. The room itself seemed clean. However, they put us in a handicap room right next to the construction. I understand hotels need updating and I didn't have a problem with the notes they left in ever room describing the construction will be done between 8am-5pm. But they didn't start at 8am they started much earlier. We called the front desk to complain about the workers being so loud earlier than described but they did nothing. They didn't even apologize. None of the staff asked us how things were going and I don't think I ever saw any of them smile once. It was not a pleasant experience. The staff was terrible and not friendly or helpful. Do not go here!
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs to adjust their attitude. There needs to be more of them. Every time we went through the front desk there was a line and one person.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to share this feedback with us.  We are pleased to hear you loved our location and would consider giving us a chance to impress you in the future.  I will follow up with the valet team right away in regards to these comments.  We apologize you felt uncomfortable and can assure you this is not what we strive for.  Thank you again for reviewing us, we hope to see you when our upgrades are completed.

review.title: Tell your guest of renovations occurring online
review.reviewText: The location is great. When we arrived the entire hotel was under renovation. The gym and computer rooms were closed for renovation. This is fine, but when we booked not once were we notified of the condition of the hotel. This was a very disappointing experience. It taught me a lesson and questions to always ask prior to booking a hotel e.g. Is your hotel under any type of remodel? Are the amenities mentioned on your website all available? The valet person working all week would get into arguments with the front desk people every single time I saw him. This made me uncomfortable with him handling a rental car I was responsible for. The front desk staff were all great. There is even a amazing Mexican place and Starbucks directly connected to this hotel. I think once all their construction is complete it could be kinda cool, but unfortunately we had a terrible experience due to the construction. The bathroom in our room was tiny. There was literally no counter and we had to leave or stuff in the sink. Last, do something about the valet driver. He even double parked my rental in the bus/taxi lane right in the CENTER of the lane. What a bad experience.

review.title: Good location, wait until construction is complete
review.reviewText: I blame Expedia for not letting us know this hotel was undergoing renovations when I made the reservation. We would not have stayed here had we known. I realize any central SF hotel is going to be expensive, but considering the mess and noise, not worth what we paid.
review.negativeRemarks: See above for my comments.

review.reviewText: Room was comfortable, but had quite a bit of construction going on. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Find Something Better
review.reviewText: We pulled up curbside and there were two workers inside doing nothing, but they didn't even bother to open the door, but I'd already paid; too late to cancel. It took a good seven minutes to finally get a key to my room that didn't work. I had to return to the desk three times before the front desk gave me a key to another room. Although recently remodeled, the shower handle was stuck. It took a great deal of messing with and strength to operate. We got a room overlooking the street. There was talking, steam release making noise from a manhole, and street walkers all night. Parking was difficult to find. Construction workers were buzzing in the morning, using the elevators and making more noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: There is a Starbucks right next door.

review.title: Would not recommend this hotel.
review.reviewText: This was the worst experience ever!  EVER! It was so noisy and dirty and under construction -the entire 1 night stay was awful and I will never go back.  I could hear the street like it was in my room and the homeless were right next to me the entire night screaming and yelling all night.  I felt scared in the halls and workout room with a non functioning water outlet.  Please do not stay here.

review.title: Pretty in a picture
review.reviewText: While the hotel inside was "ok" and I say ok due to all the construction still going on while they are open.  The rooms were clean yet small but that is what  you would expect being in a downtown hotel.  Although it does claim to have high-end shopping in  The immediate area, walking directly out of the hotel that is not what you see.   The area is not a  desirable one.   Staff was nice enough they try to make the stay  as comfortable as possible   So that always helps!

review.title: Good location, but not up to par
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva is located steps from Union Square, but there are many other hotels in the area that provide a better experience. The hotel was under renovation during my stay, but that was not an issue for me. There is no parking garage, so I had to make use of the valet, which required 30 minute notice to have it returned. The room was standard, but there was no electrical outlet available near the bed to plug my cell phone in at night. The bathroom was way too small...I was alone, but I don't see how it would be possible to share with my wife.
review.negativeRemarks: Add electrical outlets near the beds
review.locationRemarks: Steps from Union Square; shopping and restaurants

review.title: Bumpy start but hotel made good

The next morning we did return to the Diva and we were happily told that we would be upgraded to a king room and refunded for a night of our vacation.

Nice central location 
Quiet

The walls are so thin that you can hear everything said next door...windows are like no there, feels like the people talking outside are in your room, until 3 am...glass damping area very close, wakes you up at night...partys happening upstairs with loud music and screaming...fight next door not well handled, didn't feel very safe.
I travel a lot and never had such a bad experience!
I would try a different facility.

review.title: Disppointing experience
review.reviewText: From the diminuative lobby and rather impersonal service by the front desk staff to the large, dark room with teeny tiny bath this hotel has no value for the exorbitant price. There are too many better hotels in San Francisco with nicer amenities and lower rates so save your money and look elsewhere. Even the complimentary coffee maker was teeny tiny. We had asked for a jr suite with queen beds and got a king with a queen murphy bed. Really convenient - not! After a long day of travel, the last thing you need is to re-arrange your room to pull down a bed. The one bright light was the lovely fellows who helped with our bags (both up to and down from the room). Quick, courteous service there. And I get it that I was in a large city (I live in a large city with all the wonders that brings), however the neighborhood made me a bit wary. Not what we were expecting at all.
review.negativeRemarks: See comments, above. Bathrooms too small, but major reno for that to happen.

review.title: This Hotel is not what Expedia Advertises at all!!
review.reviewText: I wish I didn't have to write this letter but unfortunately your hotel was not only a complete rip off but false advertising on Expedia. We first checked into room 716 which were not the pictures that Expedia gave me when booking. Then we got a $600 deposit though I paid in full and deposit I was told should have been $100. The light bulbs in half the lights didn't work, tub was gross and water took a good 20min to get warm water. I then complained to front desk which I thought was going to do something but instead moved us to a nicer room with even less that worked in room 722. Refrigerator was not working at all, plugs didn't work, light bulbs that were out as well as bothered by hotel maintenance to fix all once we were in room which totally messed up our stay. I then asked how much to extend one more day and gave me a quote that was almost $100 more than what I paid on a weekend not for a Monday night. I was told that was no longer a Personality Hotel but bought by a Chinese company which has obviously completely ruined the hotel as all seemed to be going towards a motel than hotel as I was told by numerous staff people there. For what we went through we should have been compensated for but instead was like your hotel was p
review.negativeRemarks: Management, Hotel Conditions, Cleanliness, Pricing, Facilities...basically everything... FALSE ADVERTISING

review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Diva Hotel for one night to take advantage of Restaurant Week in SF.  Our overall experience was okay.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The room itself was a little small but decorated perfectly for the size.  The in room refrigerator smelled and didn't seem clean.  We opened the window covers to discover that we couldn't look through it.  The window was quite from the outside.  We felt that the air quality in the room seemed stuffy and full of pollutants.  As a result, we had difficulty sleeping throughout the night.  I did notice that the air conditioner in the room and the vent in the bathroom was really dusty.  It had not been vacuumed for a long time.  Also, the water pressure of the shower was really weak.  It was hard to take a quick shower.  LOL.  Lastly, we were excited to take advantage of the Sake happy hour.  However, we were disappointed to see that the Sake was in the front lobby on a small cart near the entrance of the hotel.  There was really no where to sit and relax.  We thought it was going to be in a lounge where people can sit and talk.  Again, our experience was okay.  It was good enough for the night but not good enough if we had to stay longer.
review.positiveRemarks: Hip/ Contemporary and decorated nicely for a small room with a queen bed
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel can improve on the way they clean the room and fix the pressure of the water in the shower.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of places to eat that were open really late.  Also, it is walking distance to Union Square.

review.title: Too expensive for the product it provides
review.reviewText: I think I was unlucky and got charged an extremely high room rate, if I were to pay $140- $170 dollars a night this would be totally acceptable. But I paid nearly $300 a night which was way too much for a hotel without a bar and restaurant, merely a Starbucks tagged to the side and a Mexican. No help to take cases to room and when I arrived in the room I found it pretty underwhelming. The room was very small indeed, bathroom even smaller. You can tell the rooms are tired from the multiple layers of paint on the doors. The toilet seat would not stay in the upright position, something which infuriates me immensely! However, the bed was extremely comfy and lighting in the room good. The TV quality was poor with a grainy picture - clearly not digital. I would stay here again should the price be lower, I left feeling ripped off which is never good. I found the service good but the lady that checked me in albeit very polite was maybe just a bit too much! I guess you need to judge your customer as to how to act to them, not an easy task I know and perhaps just a difference in culture and taste!

review.title: An Underwhelming hotel.
review.reviewText: I was excited to stay here because the pictures online looked amazing. The hotel rooms looked so lush and luxurious. There is nothing wrong with this hotel. The hotel is not bad but the hotel did not meet up to the expectations of the pictures. Therefore the hotel was underwhelming. Hotels in San Francisco are very expensive and I usually like to stay at something under $200. That is impossible to find in San Francisco other than dump hotels or airport hotels. Hotel Diva was around the $300 range. I dont think it really looked like a $300 a night hotel.  The room was ok. It had some nice design elements to it. Interesting head board, etc. I did have a separate sitting room/den with a flat screen tv., fun window  screen, beaded curtain for the coat closet. But like i said, not the luxury hotel i was thinking of.  The location was ok. It is on theater row. So it reminded me a lot of Times Square in NYC with all the usual party animals staggering about at night and all sorts of sketchy people during the day. There are some good restaurants next door to the hotel but I didn't have a chance to explore them. Neimans/Union Square shopping was only 3 blocks away. It was pretty easy to get cabs from here.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was interesting and stylish. Not amazing but not ur run of the mill generic hotel either. The sidewalk outside is a walk of fame.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls are very thin. I could hear everything being said in the hallways. I imagine they could hear me from my room as well.
review.locationRemarks: It is on the street where all the live theaters are. 3 blocks from Union Square / Luxury shopping. Kind of sketchy. 24 hour pizza places, etc.

review.title: Avoid if you are a light sleeper
review.reviewText:
Our room faced off the street so we thought it would be relatively quiet in this busy area of town. Unfortunately, the neighboring bars/night establishments dumb their glass bottles in the alley throughout the night multiple times. This loud clanking every few hours woke us up constantly and we got very little sleep the entire trip.

The Staff were lovely and the maids were great and friends too. Elevator takes a really long time but that is expected in such an old building.

The hotel itself is in a good location to get everywhere downtown quickly.
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff was great and the beds were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Double pane windows would help cut down the noise and working with your neighbors to not make excessive noise in the alley throughout the night.

review.reviewText: Great location in Union square,  very friendly staff!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Got a room for a one night stay in the city for a concert. Was absolutely with in walking distance to everything. There is a Starbucks right next to the lobby for a quick morning coffee grab. The rooms are small but decorated very cool and hip. Beds are clean and showers are bright and beautiful. TV reception wasn't the best but didnt use it much. I would absolutely stay here again because it wasn't your run of the mill hotel but still felt relaxing

I would definitely stay at the Diva Hotel again.  Great location for anyone who loves to shop and have a "city feel" vacation.  The staff very pleasant and the room, although a bit small, they make up for it by maximizing the space at their best.  The decor of the Diva Hotel was very modern and upscale.  And the gym is equipped with nice equipment that is above the normal hotel grade.  Thanks, Diva Hotel, for making our stay in San Francisco enjoyable.  I will truly reccommend your hotel to friends and family!!!  :)
review.locationRemarks: Location is ideal for endless shopping and nightlife just within steps of your hotel room.

review.title: Great value in San Francisco
review.reviewText: San Francisco is not a cheap place to stay and although Hotel Diva was not the most affordable it was great value in comparison to its peers. The location is great and felt safe. There's a Westin and a Hilton down the street. Our room was spacious and they had done a good job renovating it. The staff was very helpful and approachable. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. Overall, we were happy with our stay.

review.title: Small Clean Room with Great Location
review.reviewText:
This is a great 3.5 star hotel. 
It's an older building in a super awesome location.
The staff was friendly.
The rooms were small but clean. It's not the most comfortable bed, but worked. 
You do get noise from the street, but you can turn on the AC unit for some white noise. You are in the city, so you will hear the occasional siren.
Overall, we were super satisfied and pleased.

review.title: Great Central Location for walking
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great location if you want to walk all over the different neighborhoods of San Francisco, and do not mind walking a few miles to save cab/uber money.  It was very clean and modern.  There are great bars and food around the hotel.  The staff was very polite and friendly and informative.  The Starbucks connected to the hotel was a definite benefit as well.  The only odd part was there was no outlets available next to the sides of the bed but it happens with old building.  I would recommend this hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: I loved that I felt comfortable walking to many different neighborhoods from here such as Fisherman's Wharf and Haight-Ashbury.
review.negativeRemarks: Additional outlets in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent, in the middle of everything.  Two great places to east nearby are Ryoko's Sushi and CoCo Bang Korean.

The lady who helped us check in was Kendra, she was friendly, fast, knew what she was talking about and was very sweet. The room we booked had a separate kid room full of toys, separate kid sink, bunk beds, a computer and a chalkboard wall. My daughter loved it and didn't want to leave. The rooms and bathroom were both very clean and nicely decorated. We all got a comfy, good night sleep. I would definitely stay at this hotel again the next time we are in San Francisco.

review.title: The worst hotel ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: When we arrived to the hotel it was in a terrible area of town. Inside the lobby was run down and the elevator didn't work. The hotel doesn't have parking and the nearby garage charged us $50 to park our car for just one night. When we got up to the rooms, they were disgusting. The walls were dirty and scuffed. Rooms were incredibly small and the bathroom looked like it had never been cleaned. One of the pillows had makeup on it. The TV and air conditioner didn't work. We called to complain and the front desk said that there was nothing they could do because maintenance had already left and so did house keeping. We wanted to leave and asked for a refund but they refused to give us one because they said the manager wasn't there and we would have to take it up when they got there at 8a.m. We then called Expedia to see if they could help us out. Expedia talked to the front desk and they were told the same thing but made a note and said they would follow up with us in the morning. Since we are from out of town and didn't know our way around the city, and $450  out of money from the cost of the 2 hotel rooms we were forced to stay overnight. I called the front desk at 8am but the manager still wasn't in, she didn't ge in until 10 in the morning and when I told her everything we had been through over the night and complained also about the cold shower in the morning she said there was no records of me ever having filed a complaint and she would not refund the money!

The rooms do look like the pictures which is good but they are on the compact size. There is no sink in the bathroom but it's in the bedroom which I found very poor for the price I was paying. This is hidden in the pictures of the room, the sink is where the cameraman is. My toilet broken twice within an hour and the final time, maintenance had gone home so I had to leave my toilet with things in it over night.

The rooms where very clean, that is a definite.

The walls and doors are quite thin. I could hear the cleaners moving around early in the morning which meant I woke up much earlier than I wanted.

Overall, I was disappointed and wouldn't stay here again. There are other hotels in San Fran that offer better facilities and for less/same price.

review.title: Right in the right place and very comfortable!
review.reviewText:
I loved my stay in the Hotel Diva! I didn't want to leave! It was comfortable, lovely bed, lots of pillows, located very close to transport  - including the cable cars! - and great staff. The concierges, Jordan and Peter were so helpful and such fun, thank you.

I heartily recommend the Hotel Diva.

review.negativeRemarks: I can honestly say nothing to be improved! I haven't said that about any hotel so far in my 6 months travelling around the world.
review.locationRemarks: Walked to and from the Baseball Park, caught bus to the Golden Gate Bridge, from a few doors away, caught Cable Car home from Fishermans Wharf. Great!

review.title: Center of everything!
review.reviewText: Perfect location for the city experience! We walked everywhere and the cable cars were nearby. The hotel itself was very comfortable, the decor was stylish, and the staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great location for downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Everything about our stay was greatly enjoyable from the check in to the check out. The staff was friendly and very helpful.  They knew the area so could inform us a good food locations to eat and try some locate foods.
review.negativeRemarks: THe channels in on the TV most of the stations were great but the local station had poor reception so bad you couldn't be watched.
review.locationRemarks: It's location just a few block from  Union Square & Shopping. Dining locations were very close by.

review.title: Great Location, Great Stay
review.reviewText: Originally booked at an awful cheap hostel and realized me and my friends needed an immediate upgrade. We called Hotel Diva around 10PM and they tried to upsell us for $350 deluxe suite. There were a ton of vacancies and  we booked through expedia and got a room for $178. The rooms are small but well decorated. There are nearby restaurants that stay open late and walking distance(20mins) from market street shopping. I was with a group of college graduates and the rooms were insulated enough for them to make enough noise not to disturb our neighbors. We were really happy

review.title: Wanted to like it, but....meh...
review.reviewText:
Checked in for Girls Night Out with a friend. The guy checking us in confirmed our booking-1 room with a queen bed-I said "yes, that's right".  A lady working there said something to him, checked the computer & said to me "since you're two ladies, we'll give you a room with 2 beds".  I said ok as long as it didn't cost more. I found her comment so offensive. My friend and I are just friends, but what if we had actually been a couple - that's an incredibly presumptous comment to make *after* I said the 1 queen room was right! 2 ladies can't have 1 bed?!

When we got to the room, it wasn't 1 room with 2 beds. The door led to an entryway with 2 separate rooms on either side. No living area to pass it off as a suite. One room was bare with just 1 small table, dimly lit, & had a murphy bed in the wall.  I guess since we were "two ladies" she thought we should stay in separate rooms?! We both ended up staying in the one room which was a normal hotel room. This setup is only good for a couple traveling with young kids.

Later: The lobby door locks at 11pm. We got back several hours after. From the door we could see the lady at the desk. She was helping 2 men check out. We tugged the door handle to get her attention. It was 5 steps away to come open the door. The men saw us, she didn't even look up. We waited & did it again, she frowned & held up her index finger at us to wait. The men kept looking over,but she just left us there waiting on the street till she was ready to let us in
review.negativeRemarks: Staff attitude
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square

review.title: Convinient but noisy
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located just 2mins from the Union Square. However, since it is in the middle of the city, it is NOISY!!! 

The building itself is quite old. So eventhough it had been renovated, it still has the stinky smell. 

Onece was enough.
Great hotel in the theater district for a good price. Close walk to plenty of things and food.

review.title: Quick Night to the City
review.reviewText: Overall, this hotel is in an excellent place! Right across from major theaters on Geary, beside a Starbucks and just a few steps from the famous David's Delicatessen, a block from Union Square and about four blocks from China Town. The staff was nice enough and the room was clean enough. However, don't make the mistake I made. Upon check in, I was given the option of a room in the back, where I was told it would be quiet, or a room with a view in front, where I was told it was noisy. Well, my husband and I sleep with white noise so I figured it would cover the street noise in the front. WRONG!!! Geary is a very busy street, and for the most part, the street never slept, and neither did I. I take full responsibility for this, as the clerk did tell me the truth. But you can trust me on this! Nice views of the street and its vibe, but not nice at night. Wear ear plugs! Or get a room in the back where it'll be quieter. Last complaint, the bed was like a rock. If the bed had been more comfortable, I'd have given the hotel five stars, but I have been sore since I slept in the bed (three days now). I'm mid 40s, just saying; I need comfort!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The location! It was also clean. Close to many places / things.
review.negativeRemarks: Drop the money on cushier beds. The majority of the clientele I saw were my age and if you want to keep us coming back, we need to be comfortable!
review.locationRemarks: A good restaurant in every direction! Major theaters across the street. Art galleries everywhere. Union Square, China Town, Shopping, People Watching

review.reviewText: It was quiet, staff was nice. Very comfortable bed, nice toiletries.

review.title: Very noisy!
review.reviewText: The room itself is not bad.  The shower and toilet were separated from the sink which was very odd and rather inconvenient.  However, I could overlook that.  The real concern was the noise level.  Walls are paper thin.  First is was the room above ours, then it was the alley outback, next it was exercise room across the hall.  You could literally hear every movement and it was as if the treadmill was in our room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good, near lots of restaurants, bars and shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, it's a little shabby looking.  There clearly have been updates but not a total makeover.  Be prepared for the amount of homeless and beggars.

review.title: Amazing!
review.reviewText: This is the only hotel I enjoy staying at whenever I take a trip out to the city. The staff are so welcoming, the beds are extremely comfortable, just everything about this hotel is great!

review.title: Good location to Union Square
review.reviewText: Well, the location was great and if we had been given a room with the view to the back wall at a higher floor we probably would have been kinder in the rating.. But NO, we were given a street view room on the second floor which pretty much kept us up all of the nights whether it'd be drunks shouting till 5am, rubbish collectors also at 4/5am, the fire brigade (3 times a night!) or all of the above.. The bathroom was a mere shoe box and there was literally nowhere to hang your clothes unless you were there for one night only! I get the play on the burlesque-themes which we initially thought was fun when booking but being greeted with a condom in the safe and seedy/dirty blinds as well as a stained bed spread makes me think one can book the room on an hourly basis.. On the bright side.. It's close to all amenities you can wish for!

review.title: A perfect place for a DIVA to stay
review.reviewText: This was my first time staying here and I loved it.  Our room was very comfy and clean.  The hotel staff was always very friendly and attentive.  Will stay at the DIVA again : )

review.title: Perfect location, excellent hotel team
review.reviewText:
The staff is excellent. It was our first time visiting SF and this hotel is within walking distance to everything we visited. 

The staff is professional, welcoming, and they go out of their way to help make your visit hassle-free, pleasant, and memorable.

We stayed on the second floor near the back of the building. 

The carpet is a little hard (buy comfy slippers in China town or comfy socks at Sock Market at Pier 39).

The hotel provides bath robes, hair dryer, plenty of towels, pillows, and shower gel. I don't use the hotel shampoos and conditioners because I use products for color treated hair. 

The bed is super comfy, which you'll absolutely appreciate after a long day of walking and sight seeing.

Walgreen's nearby has everything you need (bath and beauty products, wine, champagne, orange juice, snacks, food, etc)

The best places to shop are close to the hotel, so you can drop off your bags and shop more. Pack super light because you'll need the space for your trip home.

It's not bad, but not the greatest.

review.title: Very comfortable & stylish, great location
review.reviewText:
I loved my stay at Hotel Diva - I wanted a comfortable place to unwind for a few days that wasn't crazy expensive, and this hotel was perfect. The bed was the most comfortable thing I've ever slept in, and I loved the style of the rooms. The bathroom was also great, floor to ceiling mirrors, tons of space, and excellent shower pressure. The lounges in the hotel were also very cool, although I didn't see anyone using them. The elevator was a tiny bit slow because the second elevator was out of order, but it was a very small inconvenience.

Location was nice and central - close to BART, Union Square, cable car stop, and walking distance to many interesting areas. One thing to note is that Geary St does border the Tenderloin area, so if you are out at night you may want to make sure you know the streets to avoid.

I was staying at the Westin St, Francis (a half block away) in one of their older rooms. I moved because for $300 a night, the additional charges for internet and parking were insulting! They were charging $14.00 for internet access and my parking bill for one night was $60.00. At the Diva, the rooms were of similar size and vintage. The internet was free and parking was $45.00. Best of all the room rate was almost a third of the St. Francis.

review.title: Decent location but cramped and damp
review.reviewText: This is a small boutique hotel without enough charm to make it interesting. Room was very small and restroom barely large enough to stand in. No joke - you could hardly turn around in it. And we're pretty thin people! Also, no fan in the restroom meant that everything was soaked after a shower. The room was stuffy and damp everyday. There are only two elevators and one was broke, so we had to wait for an elevator often. The location is decent - near Union Square - but that comes with a good amount of homeless folks about.  Overall, I'd throw in a few extra bucks for a nicer, more modern hotel next time.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: Great location! Love the decor. Staff was very friendly and attentive.

review.title: Quintessential SF Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: It's not perfect, but nothing in the City should be!  The hotel itself is quite stylish and tastefully decorated -burlesque window shades and all.  The queen sized bed was more along the lines of a full - not your standard queen. But it was extremely comfy and clean and roomy as far as SF rooms go.  Geary Street gets wild at night so if you're looking for the quiet serene experience bring earplugs or look somewhere else.  For theatre goers you couldn't ask for a better spot; the hotel is directly across from the Curran which is right next to ACT.  For shoppers Union Square is just two blocks away.  It's a great hotel and I would definitely stay there again.  Note:  If you book through a third party (e.g. Expedia) and "request" a particular room (e.g. King sized bed), a request is not a confirmation.  Call the hotel directly after booking to confirm the bed size. Our king-sized junior suite turned into something else - it was still a great room though, just a smaller bed. Overall I'm perfectly pleased with our stay.

review.title: French Consulate Visit
review.reviewText: Just minutes away from Union Square, Hotel Diva had everything I needed at a very affordable price. The hotel reminded me of modern hotels in Europe--all the important stuff (clean, great bed and linens, easy Internet access, killer location, TV)  with spare but elegant furnishings and a phenomenal staff.

review.title: Girls weekend for bachelorette
review.reviewText: This hotel lives up to its name with its posh and chic decor. Although it's very feminine in style, it is by no means for women only. We're from the Bay Area (I just moved to Atlanta) and spent the weekend at the hotel for a bachelorette party weekend and it is PERFECTLY located to everything walking distance. We even walked the 3-4 miles to Fishermans Wharf unaware of the distance since there was so much to stop to do, look at, eat, drink on the way (Shopping, Chinatown, Little Italy). I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a clean, modern, cute place to stay with super helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The location. The decor and design of the rooms. The amenities nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. It was awesome.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping, Redwood Room bar, Ruby Sky club, dinning and bars all minutes by foot. Walking to Chinatown, Little Italy and Fishermans Wharf.

review.reviewText: The Diva is a really great hotel, conveniently located a block from Union Square. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the whole place is sharply designed. Complimentary sake from 5 to 7 was well appreciated and I always like free wifi. And having a Starbucks on the ground floor, connected from the lobby, was handy. The only downside is one not in the hotel's control - a lot of outside noise. The workers at the restaurant connected to the back alley were dumping glass bottles in the bins at 3:30 in the morning each day. Even on an upper level floor, it was pretty loud. But all in all, highly recommended.

If you like simple but very nice touches this is the place to be. Rooms are small but very tastefully and modernly decorated with fine touches....Sake tasting during Happy Hour...Starbucks and dinning right adjacent to the building  However, if you want the traditional large hotel...... book somewhere else. Besides if this place gets too popular, it might not be available when I come to San Francisco. It is my new location!

review.title: It was okay but...
review.reviewText: We were very pleasantly surprised to be able to check in early on the day we arrived. After an early flight that was a particular blessing, and Christine was dear in facilitating it. The rooms are very small and appointed in modern (I suppose) art that borders on disconcerting. There were two troubling encounters with the concierge. On the first, he sold us tickets to one of the bus tours and disregarded our appeal for a five dollar off special, though we pointed it out in the ad that his hotel distributed. Second, when he told us he would handle reserving airport transport and there was a delay in doing so, he asked why we had gone to them in the first place, telling us that they were notorious for bad service. (As it turned out, they got us where we needed to be at the time we needed to be there) I felt it was rather like telling me a restaurant had been tagged with a poor health rating after learning I'd eaten there. This is mundane I suppose, we found that the menu button to order movies did not work, and when we told this to the front desk we were told that they needed to be alerted first in order to turn on the service. We did, and it still did not work. Finally though, this was Pride weekend, and the night before the parade they had one fellow on the front desk. He was good, but he should not have been asked to handle the myriad of woes that might, and did, come his way. It might've have been wiser to have someone working with him.

review.title: DO NOT PARK IN THE STREET!!
review.reviewText:
When we first arrived and thought I got lucky by there being one available spot in front of hotel diva. First thing I went in to ask the clerk if it was ok to park on the street. She said as long as you feed the meter till 6pm your all good. So I fed the meter till 6 and went about my business. The next morning I came out to get something out of my car and low and behold my window was busted out and our dvd player that we hid under the seat was gone.
I went in to tell the clerk ( the same clerk I had asked the day before if was ok to park there ) and she said oh ya that happens all the time! She ended up giving me $25.00 off the room witch I thought was insufficient.
The hotel offers valet parking for an outrageous $40 per night but a block away there is parking for $25.

PAY TO PARK
review.locationRemarks: A lot of crazies wondering the streets

review.title: Good location but disappointing staff and room
review.reviewText:
When I arrived to check-in the desk agent was polite and smiling until she saw my reservation. Then she just prepared my room key and handed it across the desk. I asked if it was a king room as requested and the reply was a flat, "You booked at a third party and you get whatever rooms they have left." So I asked if there was a king available and she said there was but not for a third party booking. What an unpleasant way to greet a first time guest or to show partnership with groups like Expedia that bring them business. I did tell her that I didn't like her unpleasant attitude, at which she replied sarcastically, "Enjoy your room." No surprise, no apology.

I found an interior room with one small window that couldn't be opened unless you wanted your neighbor viewing inside. The bathroom was large, since it was a disability room, but it had no sink or mirror. For that, you went back into the room and around the corner near the closet. It was certainly an odd layout. But being interior, no street noise to bother.

The furnishings were great and the bed was super comfortable. A nice touch was a small shaving kit of "Art of Shaving" cream and some make-up remover pads. I thought it was a little "cute" that they had a price list of all the removable pieces like pillows and throws - I guess they must get a lot of theft so I appreciated the honesty and throwing it out there. Lots of light fixtures and outlets all over the room so you could light as dim or bright as you prefer.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was super comfortable and the linens were of good quality. The toiletries provided were excellent. Great lighting and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in staff needs training.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jackie,

We are so happy to hear that you had such a great experience. Please do not hesitate to let us know if we may be of assistance for the planning of your next visit to San Francisco!

We look forward to welcoming you in the near future

Warm Regards
Virgill Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: The Diva Hotel is Fabulous!
review.reviewText: Elegance on steroids . It's a breath of fresh air for SF travel. Beautiful hotel that is friendly, comfortable and ideally located. With a Starbucks next door and a delicious Mexican restaurant attached, what more could you ask for? Comfy bed with great pillows. Super clean and new. It's my new favorite and, yes, I felt like a diva! Absolutely loved it!

managementResponses.response:
Hello,

Thank you for staying at Hotel Diva. I hope you enjoyed your stay with us. Please be assured that we will discuss with Execupark the issue you mentioned regarding the valet parking incident. Please accept my sincere apology.

We look forward to welcoming you back at Hotel Diva.

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: Great location, compact room
review.reviewText: Stayed at Hotel Diva for 4 nights recently. Location is fantastic, it's a very short walk to union square, cable cars, shopping, resturants and bikes for hire. The hotel staff were nice, not overly attentive but we also didn't need anything during our stay. The concierge left our car lighs on when parking our car in Valent parking so we had some issues when we then needed the car got get to a flight early in the morning. Pillows aren't the best but overall a nice hotel in a fabulous location and ok value for money given general rates for hotels in San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: Great amenities and nice to have opening windows in a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows on the bed were lumpy and not comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, cable car & public transport, shopping, theatres, night life/ bars, everything!

managementResponses.response:
HI hen,

Thank you for staying at Hotel Diva. I hope you enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward t welcoming you back in the near future.

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: San Fo Stay
review.reviewText: My wife and I where in San Fo for 5 days during the 3 day Winter Fancy Food Show held in Moscone as an exhibitor. Everytime we are here we would stay on a friends house, but this year you opted to check in and we stayed in Hotel Diva. Overall it was OK. the room is clean specially the bathroom, cozy feeling, complete room amenities ( but water are not free and starbucks on the lobby ) except no A/C but who would need an a/c in San Fo? obviously you can hear all the different noise from the outside at night...but it's fun! would recommend this hotel but would also mention the no a/c
review.positiveRemarks: Location... and It has a Starbucks downstairs and jack in the box and lots of restos nearby...
review.negativeRemarks: the Elevator and the in-room Safe..
review.locationRemarks: Location is great.. cable car stop is just few blocks away. it is near union square

review.title: Great location, friendly helpful staff, good value
review.reviewText: Perfect location to hit all San Fran tourist attractions, clean rooms, and super staff.

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText:
In the middle of downtown close to major attractions: cable car stop, chinatown, market st, hop on
Hop off bus.
The rooms are ok but in the night time are a little bit noisy from steps of the rooms above.

review.title: Nice hotel and great location
review.locationRemarks: Very close to shopping theatre and public transport

review.title: AWSOME HOTEL! A tucked away secret
review.reviewText: I've always considered this hotel in the past but opted for the larger chain hotels but went with this hotel mainly for its location. This hotel is AWSOME (and that's an understatement). Stayed here while on a trip for job interviews (moving to SF), was allowed to check in early and was given a room overlooking the street (didn't mind as I am an urban person and like the noise of the city). Room is small but sufficient, it was the small touches and amenities. There are 3 (or more) different lounges on various floors, I used them when couple of friends came by as we planned the day. There is a small but adequate fitness center (didn't get to use it, I had some kind of excuse as always) and Starbucks is adjacent to the hotel with access via the lobby during certain hours. Also the ramen place 2 doors down that hotel promotes on its website. Only bad thing to say about this hotel is that I couldn't stay longer, each and every staff I encountered were very friendly, sounds like a cliché but its true; the maids, front desk, concierge, maintenance everyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! Everyone who worked there embodied what the hotel represents (good job hiring manager).
review.negativeRemarks: We couldn't access one of the lounges with room key and the shower faucets leaked a little, but I'm sure both are on their list of things to do.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, close union square, muni, BART, shopping; but far enough away from the heavy foot traffic that other hotels have stomping past.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Naomi,

Hotel Diva offers various room from deluxe rooms to studios, all available on Expedia/Hotels.com. I'm so sorry to hear you didn't have towels upon checking in to your room. Please be assured that I am looking into what might have had happened. Please accept my apology.

We look forward to welcoming you back at Hotel Diva.

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: Not great for the price
review.reviewText: We stayed here for one night, as a small getaway. The room and bathroom were extremely small. We had no towels, which we had to call and have them bring up. Shouldn't towels be a no brainer? The hotel itself was nice, but for the price it was not great. I felt like I was staying in someone's small bedroom as opposed to a hotel. But apparently that's how they want you to feel.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for staying at Hotel Diva. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.negativeRemarks: bathroom

review.title: Great location, close to Union Square. Rooms on th
review.reviewText: Hotel staff is fantastic! Rooms on the small side to be expected in a refurbished older building. . Bathroom very cramped. Noise outside from dumpsters and could here rooms upstairs showing, etc. overall good deal, clean and great location.

review.title: Super location with nice decor
review.reviewText: Location was outstanding. Room decor was beatiful. Drawbacks is bathroom was tiny and not in line with rest of room. Needs better lighting close to closet as one need to use cell phone flashlight to look in suitcase. Other than taht ot was awesome

review.title: Close to downtown
review.reviewText:
Opposite Curran Theater, stayed 1 night with 2 rooms. 2 Adults and 2 Kids.
Rooms were adjoining with a private corridor which we found to be useful.
Great Mexican restaurant nextdoor on one side and Starbucks on the other.
Valet parking warning: It takes 45 minutes to get your car for some unknown reason,
so try to plan ahead. I got very frustrated as it was eating into our time to enjoy San Francisco.

Nice decor in the lobby and rooms. Clean and not too expensive.
Beware of the water bottles in the room as they charge $3.50 for them and they are not in teh fridge.

Wireless coverage was OK but not good enough to stream netflix we found.
2 blocks from Union Square, very central. A bit noisy on the street side at night.

Overall I would recommend it now that we know the things to avoid..

review.title: Unique Hotel and great location near Union Square.
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the Hotel Diva. It is unassuming, yet classy. If you are a couple looking for a romantic getaway or a family with older kids, it is great. From the helpful staff at the front desk to the housekeeping staff, we were very pleased. Our rooms were away from the street, so it was very quiet. As a family of five, it's sometimes difficult to find a place that is accommodating. However, the Diva worked well. We had a King room, perfect for a couple. Their rooms have the sink separated from the bath. Our adult sons were in a roomy King Suite across the hall. The in room coffee makers and refrigerators were helpful for our extended stay. There were ice and water machines on every floor. The various sitting areas on the floors were both quaint and functional.
review.positiveRemarks: NOT your usual hotel. Really enjoyed the Art Deco style furnishings. They were included in EVERY detail. Pleasant surprises everywhere. Hot chocolate.
review.negativeRemarks: To be picky, better lighting in the elevators. Also, sadly, the homeless people are everywhere. Give them a meal and a bath and bed for a night?
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Theatres, Union Square, shopping, bus stop, mom & pop restaurants, Irish pub, pizza, Italian, Mexican, Starbucks, Chinese & fast food.

review.negativeRemarks: Elevators
review.locationRemarks: Good location, convenient to walk everywhere.

review.title: HOtel Diva
review.reviewText: Great staff, comfy room all in the heart of SF!
review.negativeRemarks: Fan in bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Union Square-great restaurants and shopping

managementResponses.response: Thank you!

review.negativeRemarks: There was a coffee maker but no pot. The bathroom sink drained slowly.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping and dining

review.title: Great location and even quiet!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was very well priced given its proximity to Union Square and the fact that my stay was between Thanksgiving and Christmas ... the busiest time of year for Union Square shopping! Because my hotel was on the inside, it was very quiet. I only had a view of a tiny central courtyard (read 'air shaft/light shaft') but that didn't bother me one bit since I was in the middle of a very active part of the city but enjoyed peace and quiet! Plus, their artful shades made the room very pleasing looking and I could simply walk outside for a terrific view.

The bed was VERY comfortable. The hotel is quite eco-conscious, which is to my liking. Overall, an excellent place to call home while in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Directly across from the Curran Theater. Two blocks from all of the terrific Union Square shopping. Very close to all public transportation options.

review.title: Good location, bring your ear plugs!
review.reviewText: Good location at a great price. The hotel is clean and the staff is very helpful and respectful. The only downside is the street noise which can be an issue for every hotel in Union Square. If you want a good night sleep don't forget to bring ear plugs!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, friendly staff, easy accessible location.
review.negativeRemarks: Better insulated windows to block out the street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, easy transportion to local attractions like Chinatown, Alamo Square, and the Golden Gate Park.

review.title: Excellent Fun Hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Very clean, a lot of fun! I enjoyed the sexy Sake hour, the Perrier bubble lounge, starbucks right down below. Staff was fun and knowledgeable too! A great find!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Super cool and fun, clean great vibe
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, shopping, bike rentals everything was perfect

managementResponses.response:
Dear London Traveler,

Thank you for choosing Hotel Diva on your recent trip to San Francisco. I hope you enjoyed your stay with us.

We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: Hotel with lots of personality
review.reviewText: Nice boutique hotel that is close to Union Square and all the great shopping that San Francisco has to offer.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, uniqueness and comfort of the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Theatres, art galleries and shopping all within walking distance

review.title: Close to Union Sq Cable Car Hop On Hop Off Buses R
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: See above

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for staying at Hotel Diva. I'm glad you enjoyed your stay with us. I hope you will think of us again on your next visit to San Francisco.

We look forward to welcoming you back at Hotel Diva.

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: Wonderful Experience!!
review.reviewText: We made the trip to SF to see Van Morrison at the Masonic. We were able to walk to the venue from the Hotel Diva. Although, it was all uphill, it was only 5 blocks.....very centrally located. Close to Chinatown, lots of shopping, cable cars and lots of good restaurants. We loved staying there. Our room was in a very quiet location of the hotel and we didn't hear any outside noise. I also enjoyed the sake that was served in the late afternoon.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Rita,

Thank you for staying at Hotel Diva. I'm sorry to hear your stay was not as pleasant as you would have expected. I hope you will give us the chance to make it up to you. We look forward to welcoming you back at Hotel Diva.

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez

review.title: Great service, but room is depressing.
review.reviewText: Front desk was very friendly. The room was dark and cramped. It was clean, but some flaws. There is slope at the end if the bed, almost fell from it. The bathroom door handle was broken. The wall colors were dark and depressing. Felt like I was being locked up and put in that room. The bed was comfortable and the shower was alright. The elevators were cool.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mike,

I'm so sorry to hear that there were some hiccups during your recent stay with us. Please accept my apology. Please be assured that I am looking into your comments and will most certainly correct them all.

I hope you will give Hotel Diva another chance and that you will give us the opportunity to change your impression on us. Please let us treat you like a Divo!

We look forward to welcoming you back at Hotel Diva.

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: Didn't treat me like a Diva
review.reviewText: The room was small but nice but not well lit, especially near the sink which wasn't in the bathroom. It was mostly clean but you could tell the bathroom wasn't really scrubbed as there was rust on some of the metal and the ceiling needed some scrubbing. I desperately needed water at 11:30pm, the mini bar was completely empty and the soda dispenser down the hall wasn't working when I called the front desk I was told that there was a Walgreens down the street that I could walk to. Getting ready to check out the next day I saw that there were supposed to be robes in the room, but I couldn't find any. Luckily when we did check out there was a manager there who actually seemed upset that we didn't get the best service and gave us a discount but I think if he hadn't been there we just would have gotten blank stares.

review.title: Convenient and Clean
review.reviewText: Very easy to get to the conference hotel (the Hilton) with very good coffee in the room and a Starbucks off the lobby. Very helpful staff in finding an item I needed to purchase and in looking up directions to get to a site by public transportation.
review.locationRemarks: I went for a convention, but there is a lot of shopping in the area.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for the 5 stars on Expedia!

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: Nice, affordable hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: Liked my stay there

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great downtown location. The Mexican restaurant next door was fantastic. Would definitely stay here again. Take the room upgrade. Its worth the extra 22$ per night. The room is much larger.

review.positiveRemarks: Great location, near Union Square, Equinox and my headquarter for work.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a peanut underneath bed that sat there for a few days and was never cleaned before I entered the room as a guest.

review.title: noise from other rooms in convenient locale
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay twice within 1 week both before and after a bike trip to Napa and Sonoma. The noise from others coming into their rooms and getting settled at all hours was a little much considering the price point we paid. The AC stopped working in the middle of the night (3am) and we did not contact management - just dealt with it. That was not the hotel's fault. Helpful staff. Great recommendation for nearby sushi restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Do something about the noise of the doors closing. Lock mechanism is very loud and not controllable by gently closing door.

review.title: Centrally placed with easy access to most of sFran
review.reviewText:
Nice placement and staff
Lack a space to sit and talk
Some rooms have very cramped bathroom facilities
Beds comfortable and clean
review.negativeRemarks: Blue lights in elevator ......why not the usual white?
review.locationRemarks: Everything basically is close or accessible "Biscuits and blues" is around the corner if you care for a night of good blues and beer Reserve seats

review.title: Most AMAZING Hotel
review.reviewText: I have traveled to quite a few places and this hotel was the most amazing hotel I have ever stayed at. I loved the location, it was so close to everything, and very safe. The staff was amazing and friendly when it came to any needs, questions, even directions. The room itself was beautiful, so comfortable, so clean and so quiet. THere is even a Starbucks attached!! I loved my stay at hotel Diva and I would return in a heartbeat.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the look of the hotel, it was so comfortable, clean, and friendly. It was in the best location.
review.negativeRemarks: It is disappointing to pay for your hotel room and then an additional $40 a night for parking..but I guess that is the city for you.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, shopping, best cd store ever, trolly cars, restaurants, bars, it was very well located

review.title: Slick hotel, good location, friendly staff
review.reviewText:
The hotel:

Excellent location, just off Union Square and only a few blocks walk to both train and bus stations (if needed). However, if you take a right when leaving the hotel you will soon find yourself in the Tenderloin - which although didn't feel threatening is the not the most attractive part of the City.

The interior of the hotel itself is very smart, with a coffee house and Mexican next door.

Staff:

Very friendly and were always happy to help. The only problem we found was that their recommendations for local eateries were disappointing.

Room:

Clean, modern and spacious with all the facilities needed for a comfortable stay (in room coffee machine, IPOD dock, bath robe, flat screen TV...). Only criticism is that the room suffered from a lack of lighting, and could be a little dark at certain times of the day.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff recommendations Room lighting
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from Union Square and 3-4 from the main Market Street shopping streets.

review.title: Characterful Hotel
review.reviewText: Second stay here - but first was 8 years ago! Hotel is still great, clean, tidy and with enough character to distinguish it from your everyday downtown hotel. Staff helpful and efficient.

review.title: Near Union Square in central SF.
review.reviewText: Very easy access to cable car, trolley-bus and muni-bus. Hotel staff very cheerful, positive and helpful. Room a little cramped but clean and very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Very helpful staff and clean and confortable room.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Lots of things to see in central SF

review.title: Hotel Diva was great!
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva is in an excellent location. Staff & customer service was outstanding. Room was very clean and had fun and different looking furniture and features than other hotels. We asked for a quiet room (one that wouldn't face the street) with a refrigerator and both of our requests were met. I recommend asking for a quiet room as the street can definitely be noisy even late at night. Overall the hotel was great!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean "fun" room, friendly front desk. Location.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square, cable car, China Town...all walking distance. There are several 24 hour dining places within the block which is convenient

review.title: Easy access to union square
review.reviewText: Had lost wallet and check in with airport tag was more difficult than it should have been

review.title: Ok in a pinch
review.reviewText: They kept me waiting on my room for 30 minutes past the reservation time. And while the staff were perfectly nice, I didn't think the bellman had a great service attitude when I asked for a taxi.

managementResponses.response:
Hello AusBoy,

Thank you for posting your comments on Expedia.com. On behalf of the front desk staff at Hotel Diva, I would like to thank you for your kind words: "The staff are up there with the best of them in the industry". We truly take pride in providing our guests with the best service possible. We look forward to weeing you again soon!

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: Average hotel, but staff make it 5 star!
review.reviewText:
Happily stay here again. Hotel was renovated uniquely which a nice change on a holiday, quality isn't up there with top hotels but I don't think that was their intention. The staff however are up there with the best of them in the industry. Bed was pretty great too and seriously that's what you need mainly a nice comfortable bed to sleep on. Never did the Sake hour as Sake is not my thing, but do be warned it is just a bottle and glasses at the front door. Never saw anyone participate during the week I was there and it's an awkward spot for it. Not totally bad, but just don't have high expectations of it as I usually love wine hour other hotels put on to mingle with other guests.

Mexican restaurant next door is pretty amazing too so check that out if you stay here. I'll be back as long as the price is reasonable compared to some of the 4-5 star hotels in this city I'd love to otherwise try.

managementResponses.response:
Dear APH,

I am so sorry to hear your experience at Hotel Diva was not as pleasant as you expected. Please accept my apology. I hope you will give Hotel Diva another chance and give us the opportunity to change your impression on us. I know we could do better. We would love to welcome you back at Hotel Diva.

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: Gross
review.reviewText: Upon arrival was told I was 'upgraded' to a suite. Went up and room smelled bad. Looked for thermostat- none. Called down and said I couldn't stay in a room with no air. They moved me to a room with an AC unit stuck in the wall. It was late so I stayed but in the morning I checked out and found another hotel for the rest of my stay. Avoid.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Michael,

Thank you for the 5 stars! Just a thought, maybe it wouldn't be too bad if you mentioned Hotel Diva? :)

We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Best regards,
Virgil Lopez
Hotel Manager

review.title: As Long As You Could Bear the Name
review.reviewText: I've stayed almost everywhere in SF, from 5 stars to 2 stars with almost over 100 visits in the last 5-8 years. Hotel Diva was a shock...yeah..they don't have the lobby like the Clift or the bar, but who cares, the rooms are huge, beds are super comfortable, its very very quiet, showers are great...I really can't think of anything wrong BUT the name. Its the stupidist name ever and as a business guy (I'm in the 35-45 demo), there is no way on earth would I tell anybody that I was staying at "Hotel Diva" because the absolute dorkiness of whoever named this place. So for now on, I will certainly stay there and just tell everyone I am staying near the Clift (which is across the street).
review.negativeRemarks: Change the name.
review.locationRemarks: Best location in SF Union Square.

review.title: Older hotel in an excellent location
review.reviewText:
All of the staff here were unbelievably friendly and organized, eager to please. The concierge gave us great tips for where to eat/drink and was able to book a flat-rate car for us to take to the airport at the ungodly hour of 3:30 am. The hotel itself is an old building and, therefore, the rooms are a bit smaller than you may find at a chain hotel. This was to be expected in the middle of San Francisco. The location is unbeatable and we were able to walk and bus to all of our destinations (wise ease). The price is right: as students we were able to afford the stay.

I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

review.title: Funky on Geary.
review.reviewText:
This is a very cute hotel. I called it "funky" because while not entirely perfect like the big-name chains,
it had a certain charm to it that the chains don't have. For instance, I had to get the staff
to replace one of the burned-out bulbs in a lamp, had to get them to replace a rubber stopper
in the toilet tank because the toilet would run continuously after a flush unless you
manually manipulated the mechanism inside the tank, I cleaned my own really filthy air conditioner
filters, my toilet was not entirely cleaned one time, and one of the elevators was
not working for half a day. It was also located near where a lot of the San Francisco homeless would hang out.
They were harmless but very obvious, but that seemed to be true in most of the downtown area.
But that is San Francisco. Across the street is a 24 hour diner -- The Pinecrest -- which has awesome breakfasts.
Close to all transportation and shopping. All in all, I really liked the hotel and would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit more attention to things like the A/C filters. I did mention it to the staff, and they were very appreciative that I made them aware of it.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping center, wonderful breakfasts at the Pinecrest, Union Square park is lovely.

review.title: Great Location to Stay
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed the City and Food and all the sites. The tours can be booked on line or the hotel staff can help in booking.
The tour operator's for Viator(Wine Country&Muir Woods)) and Horizon Coachlines(Monterey&Carmel) were Great.
Easy to get around city by way of public transportation or walking. Make sure you have good walking shoes and warm clothes and jacket. We were there in July. Ask what areas to stay out of if you plan to walk the city at night. A lot of stores to shop.
Monterey Aquarium was well worth the look.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and services was very good. It was very close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in was late. If you arrive early, plan to go site seeing until after 3pm check-in. They will take the luggages and store it for you.
review.locationRemarks: Walgreens has a small grocery store that we found had very good food products. There is a old Diner just down from the hotel, good breakfast place.

review.title: Hip decor, not a great surrounding.
review.reviewText:
I loved the decor and design if the hotel.
My room was wonderful. I was so excited to stay until the night came. My room was over a trash alley in which crashing glass and dumpsters kept me up all night. I tried to move but the hotel was sold out. They offered ear plugs!
Not a good thing. The location is close to Union Square and that was good. But the direct neighborhood outside the hotel was little scary.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise!
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location but not. Great one directly in front of the hotel.

review.title: Great.
review.reviewText: My room was great for my beautiful fiance and myself. The location is OK. My TV didn't work but they'll subsidized my rate to an adequate and pleasing amount to make up for the inconvenience. The valet price was $40 per night. I recommend finding parking elsewhere. Also, when I received my car which is a manual, the clutch was omitting an unbelievably bad smell. I could have raised hell but I had to get on the road.
review.negativeRemarks: better valet service.
review.locationRemarks: lots of food and live music.

review.title: Trash pick up every day @ 3am.
review.reviewText: While the rooms are comfortable , and the staff is friendly. The trash truck can be heard everyday @ 3am. One morning the maid was kind enough to knock so that could clean @ 8:15am. My thought is 10am. Nice place to stay over all.
review.negativeRemarks: Better windows to buffer sound. Reduce the gap at the bottom of the door, check the shower heads to know that the function correctly & are secured.
review.locationRemarks: Location is awesome and a short distance to many great places to eat, and tour.

review.title: Hotel Diva
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a problem with our AC in our room, they sent someone to fix it but it still did not work so we moved rooms. The hotel is a little dated, the rooms were kind of small but all in all a decent hotel.

review.title: Great and reasonably priced
review.reviewText:
The location of hotel diva is impeccable. It is within a block from Macy's and union square, making shopping so easy. The hotel is cozy, but our party found the rooms a bit too small and dark. The bAthroom is also small. But the room is always kept clean.

We had an incident with valet. Valet messed up our ticket and we had to wait over an hour on both days for our car. And one time they lost the car for some reason but ended up finding it. It was the valets fault and the hotel was apologetic and tried to resolve the issue.

Overall the hotel staff was courteous and we were always greeted every time.

Note that if u are booking the hotel through Expedia, u won't be Able to enjoy the Perks with the hotels loyalty program.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom is too small
review.locationRemarks: Awesome and super convenient

review.title: In the heart of Union Square- AMAZING
review.reviewText:
This hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Union Square. It is VERY modern with every convenience. There is a Starbucks right next door with an entrance to our hotel. The staff was amazing with awesome recommendations to local restaurants. Every place we went to was a hit. The staff, or should I specifically point out Aileen, was VERY knowledgable with how to plan our days to get the most out of our stay. They were very quick to accommodate transportation to the airport and also route us around the city.

The hotel has about 8 floors, so not incredibly huge, if that's what you are looking for, but it is on a main street. Once you walk out the doors, there are a million things to do and places to eat. The gym also has small lounges for guests to meet at and also a small gym with cardio machines and free weights. (Just enough for a nice workout). There is also cable TV in all the rooms and a safe in the closet.

I honestly loved this hotel. I didn't want to leave. I would highly recommend it in s heartbeat, and I will definitely be going back.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern look, everything was updated and innovative and friendly staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. Everything was perfect!
review.locationRemarks: There is a Macys down the street and a bunch of other stores in the area. There are a bunch of fast food and sit-down restaurants in the area.

review.title: Love Hotel Diva
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay(5 nights) at Hotel Diva, very much. The staff was very courteous and polite and the concierge had excellent advice as to which areas of town to avoid. They were also helpful in recommending cafes and restaurants as per our needs and best methods of transportation for different places we wanted to go to. Our room was on the seventh floor and very quiet. It reminded us of a European room, not too big, a small bathroom but the bed was very comfortable and that was important since we were hardly in our room except to rest and sleep at the end of the day. There was a complimentary Sake in the lobby all evening (we would have preferred wine, being so close to vineyards) and there were various lounges were we could enjoy complimentary teas, flavoured water and Perrier.
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness, complimentary offerings, polite staff, closeness to Union Square and all modes of transportation and a very comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: would have liked proper nightstands and maybe a small dresser
review.locationRemarks: excellent location, close to Union Square, restaurants, 24hr.diners, shopping galore, close to the Cable Car and all modes of transportation

review.title: Nice hotel, great location. Clean comfortable room
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva is located in the middle of downtown San Francisco, near shops and great restaurants. Bisquits and Blues around the corner is geat,, also Katana-Ya very near. It's also near a metro station and bus stops. Rooms are clean, well kept and comfortable. Gym is so-so.

review.title: A Diva girl's dream hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hotel Diva at the end of July 2013 and had an overall great experience! The front desk staff was fantastic and friendly. The rooms are so hip, chic, and very comfortable!! We also LOVED the amazing Mexican restaurant Colibri attached to the hotel! So fun!
review.negativeRemarks: Unfortunately, there is a smell of smoke in the halls. Our room didn't smell of smoke but the hallways really did.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Colibri Mexican restaurant, other great restaurants all around, Macy's, and other great shopping!

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was a good size and clean & also fast wifi. Would stay here again.

review.title: excellent accommodations and convenient location
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and friendly and did everything they could to make my stay comfortable and enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: location and quality of room, services, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and museums. Easy walk to cable cars, trolleys and BART trains.

review.title: Edgy and sexy hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is ideal for younger people to stay at. Whether they are a couple or just a couple of friends, it is comfortable. Good for families too, but some of the decorations might not suit Children. It used to be an apartment building, so the rooms are not huge. But they are very comfortable and a good size. The decor is very hip and modern with a lot of gray, black, white, and purple color schemes. There is a funny surprise in the safe! Bathroom size is good and the location of the hotel is perfect. It is right in the middle of union square like two blocks down from the shopping areas. Hotel staff is really really nice and helpful with anything from hotel services to travel suggestions.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great, staff is very friendly, and beds are so comfortable! And the elevator was my favorite!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was great!
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of union square. Next to the shopping area. Normal and high fashion stores. Westfield mall. Cute cafes everywhere. Cable car ride

review.title: Cute hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are a bit small, but comfortable. Overall, enjoyable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: More storge space, especially in the bathroom, as the sink takes up the entire counter top
review.locationRemarks: Quick walk (less than 5 mins) to Union Square/major transportation, great shopping Restaurants in the area are mainly chains or overly touristy pl

review.title: Good place
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent, and cannot say enough good things about the. The building was pretty old, a little noisy. Perfect place to stay if you are a student, but may not be ideal for a family.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText:
This is a very nice hotel. If you want/need a big blush room this is NOT the place for you. The room is small. Very nice but small. It was more than adequate for myself and my wife. The room is very nicely done in a boutique/trendy hotel kind of motif. Very high end sinks, faucets, etc. There's a nice desk and the bed is very comfortable.
The staff is wonderful, whether it was asking for directions, getting a cab, restaurant recommendations, etc. On occasion we would leave our room late and there was never an issue getting the room cleaned.
There's a Starbucks attached to the lobby and the Mexican restaurant next door is definitely worth a visit.
We would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice location about a block from Union Square Great staff Nice free little extras like in room coffee and WIFI
review.negativeRemarks: The WIFI could be faster with a stronger signal The hall ways are kind of dark. A few sconces would help.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in a great location about block from Union Square. It's a couple of block from the cable cars which take you to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great Location. Unique Hotel.
review.reviewText: We arrived with a 6 hour delay in the early morning at the hotel and were promptly checked in.
