The room size is fine for two people, just needs a little co-ordination in the bathroom but hey you got a great location. The decor is quite unique. We loved it. The bed was very comfortable and the shower has great pressure. You really have everything you need in the room. Hair dryer, iron, TV, a safe (take a look even if you don't need it), fridge, shampoo, soap, conditioner, lotion, wine opener and in-room FREE Wi-Fi. There are about 10 hangers in the closet. There is no mini-bar in your room but Walgreens is just around the corner if you need water and there is a Starbucks right behind the lobby. Water with orange slices and sake is being served right in the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the decor and the location was just brilliant. Close to a lot of restaurants, shopping, nightlife and the cable cars.

review.title: Union square Diva
review.reviewText: We had planned a 3 day weekend in SF but the airport closed due to the Asiana plane crash and all flights were cancelled. Hotel Diva was able to accomodate us for 2 days in the same room until we could get a flight. The staff including housekeeping were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and quiet with modern, diva style decor. The hotel is centrally located and has great restaurants nearby. Make sure and try Taylor's or Honey, Honey for breakfast. We walked everywhere since it was the 4th of July weekend and it was a 45 min wait for the cable cars plus the BART was on strike. We plan on staying at Hotel Diva again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco and, we loved it. The location if our hotel was perfect. The staff were helpful and welcoming. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is traveling to the city.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the am inane, and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing at this time.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect, I feel like you are able to get a true sense of what the city has to offer while staying here.

review.title: Underrated
review.reviewText:
The hotel room I stayed in was Stylish and comfortable. The bed was amazing! with a large spacious room, however the bathroom was fairly small. The staff are helpful and having a starbucks next door was useful.

The location was fantastic as we were close to prime shopping and dinning.

This hotel is underrated by its 3 stars.
review.locationRemarks: Prime location

review.title: Family of four
review.reviewText: Great location right near Union Square. Absolutely loved the king sized bed and our adult children could share the Murphy bed. So nice for a family of four. The room was so quiet. We did not hear any street noise as our room faced the inner court. The bathroom is very small. Nice to have extra sink in suite. Also liked the table for being able to eat in the room. Only thing we missed was having a sports channel on the TV.
review.positiveRemarks: King sized bed, modern interior design, suitable for a family
review.negativeRemarks: Edge of the Murphy bed was very sharp, stubbed my toe.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location near Union Square

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: this place doesn't look quite as nice as in the pictures advertised. A bit disappointed upon arrival. For 250 a night I thought the rooms were much bigger. No view... only of a building. To park my car for 2 days it ran me 92$. not happy about that.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly, rooms were clean
review.negativeRemarks: cheaper parking

review.title: Nice walking distance from everything
review.reviewText: This hotel is such a nice place and the rooms are so well designed and a great experince
review.positiveRemarks: The design and layout of the rooms as well as friendly staff members
review.negativeRemarks: Valet service is terrible, they brought my car back as if it was rained on and said it was condisation...
review.locationRemarks: Experinced Pride event for the weekend

review.title: Fantastic location! Comfy room, helpful staff too!
review.reviewText: I was in town to run the San Francisco Half Marathon and needed an affordable hotel close enough to all of the race activities. This was a fantastic find! Granted, since this hotel is a couple of blocks from Union Square there are tons of tourists and a lot of traffic to contend with. Depending on how & when you arrive at the hotel, the traffic could make a taxi ride a little more pricey. But, the location offers walking distance to everything! Shopping & public transportation down on Market Street are only a few blocks away. There's a Starbucks just off the hotel lobby that opens at 5:30 am which was super convenient for me, as a runner, who had to be up early for the race. It's also great for tourists heading out early for sightseeing. There's also an authentic Mexican restaurant- Colibri off the lobby as well and a pizza place next to that so while SF has endless other dining options, these are great places to keep in mind if you don't feel like going too far. Also convenient was a Walgreen's just 2 blocks up from the hotel where you can pick up snacks, bottled water or anything you may have forgotten to pack. The hotel staff, especially Eileen, were lovely and always happy to help. They made me feel like an old friend as I returned to the hotel each time. I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Just what we needed.
review.reviewText: Great easy location, Starbucks right next door as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Dripping shower when off.

review.title: In the middle of action, but sometimes too close
review.reviewText:
Hotel Diva is located near Union Square and is just a short walk from Union Square, Powell Station, and China Town.

Unfortunately it also means you will see lots of undesirables near by, like homeless people greeting you as you exit the hotel.The staff is not too concerned about it.

We were offered a choice of room on check in and chose a quieter room, but it comes with no view. You will have to trade in street view vs. quiet room.

Rooms were very clean and the housekeeping did a great job keeping up. Super fresh linens and towels smelled great and were crisp and pleasant. Diva offers multiple pillows of varying softness, however mattresses are very firm. Those who like softer mattress will not feel great sleeping on these. My wife is one of those people, she could not sleep comfortably for the duration of our stay because mattresses were too firm. But I like firmer mattress and slept very well here.

Starbucks adjoined the hotel is very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, good housekeeping Close to tourist attractions
review.negativeRemarks: Clean up the street in front of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, China Town, Powell Station

review.title: SF 4 day stay
review.reviewText: Very comfortable beds, small room/very small bathroom (expected this in downtown SF however) reasonable price. Decor was nice, but lighting was quite dim- difficult to do makeup! Location was excellent. Overall a very nice experience. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Contemporary, Modern but Old Hotel
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed the trendy, fun setting of the Hotel Diva which is only blocks away from Union Square. I attended this hotel for business meetings in SF and have stayed here in years past. The room I received was decorated in modern style with a leather sofa sleeper, two leather swivel chairs and a huge king size bed. I had a street facing view (whereas other rooms have an internally facing view of other rooms) on the second floor which faced the Curran theatre, however, my only gripe was that my particular room did not have any AC! Given the recent humid heat wave, it was quite unbearable and forced me to open the two windows inviting all aspects of street noise, smoke from people passing by (due to being on the 2nd floor), and lack of privacy. When I addressed this with the hotel at check out, they informed me that I should have asked for a fan when I was thinking that they should just leave standing fans in the room so the guest doesn't have to bother the front desk. I'm also thinking that the room has poor heating since an electric resistance heater was unplugged and didn't look adequate to cover the entire room. The room also had poor lighting and I had to turn on every floor lamp, bed lamp and overhead lamp to light the room.On a positive note, the room had an alcove by the entrance with a dedicated office/bar with a mac mini.

Hotel Diva is a very eclectic hotel and if you want something with personality, this might be up your alley but be sure and avoid room 222!
review.negativeRemarks: Dedicated AC or at least standing fans in room 222!
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to Union Square, SOMA (South of Market Area), etc.

review.title: Overpriced and noisy!!!
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel because of the location and that was the only positive thing. Staff is not friendly, they didnt help us with our suitcases. The room was very small, it had a damp smell, with a small bed, the tv didnt work, no drinking warer in the minibar, homeless people fighting all night downstairs, it was just way too loud!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Modern hotel
review.reviewText: Booked hotel on line. Very pleased with my selection
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location. Excellent staff extremely helpful and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Room could have more outlets
review.locationRemarks: Right around the corner from union square

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were all very welcoming and helpful! I would highly recommend Christian who was great! I love the location, very practical, and the hotel was comfortable, especially the beds which were like sleeping on clouds!
review.positiveRemarks: The friendliness of the staff, the option of going to Starbucks and the overall cozy feel of the place.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be a good addition to have a fridge in the room and the floor boards were exceptionally creaky!
review.locationRemarks: Great starting point as this hotel is near many restaurants, the cable car, Chinatown and many fabulous shops and the huge mall.

review.title: In Union Square close to everything
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed just one night here for the Wipro San Francisco marathon. I expected to just come here to crash for the night after the expo and get a good night's sleep. We got a room on the 2nd floor that faces the front of the hotel right on Geary street. I should have listened to the other reviews about how loud it was with the traffic and people outside even in the middle of the night. My husband and I were able to sleep, but got woken up like 3 or 4 times each due to the noise. The walls and windows are very thin and you can hear everything. Maybe a room higher up and not facing the main street might have helped decrease the noise.
We got a deluxe queen bedroom which is pretty small, but we just wanted to stay there one night anyway to sleep before our marathon. The hotel itself is nice and clean, and appeared well kept.
The price for the room seems a little steep since the hotel didn't seem any better than your regular $150/night hotel which usually even includes a continental breakfast, but I guess you pay for the location and being close to everything you may want to see in San Francisco.
My only real problem with the hotel is the noise and sound since we just came to be close to our marathon race start location and get a good night's sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Very noisy in room from the street- don't know what they can do about this...maybe thicker windows and walls
review.locationRemarks: It's in Union square and about a mile away from Embarcadero. There are many shops and restaurants nearby within walking distance.

review.title: Friendly hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, comfortable and conveniently located. The staff were very helpful. I liked that they were fridges in every room, but missed having a kettle to boil non-coffee flavoured water. Unfortunately, there were garbage truck pick ups two of the five nights we were there that were very loud and disruptive at 3:30 a.m.!
review.negativeRemarks: 3:30 a.m. wake up call.
review.locationRemarks: Five minute walk to Union Square; ten minute walk to Market St.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Room was a bit small but clean. Good location with many shops, food and amenities nearby

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, friendly helpful staff, very clean and well kept. Only downside (and this is not to do with the hotel) if visiting with a car is check for parking. It can be expensive. But that generally goes for everywhere in the city.

review.title: Good location for central town and shops etc
review.reviewText: Very noisy at the back and worse at the front. Be prepared. Heat may be a problem in the summer
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Good central location

review.title: Hotel Diva - San Francsico -- lovely place to stay
review.reviewText: The room was relatively quite, with the exception of doors slamming. No easy way to not let them make noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Slamming Doors
review.locationRemarks: Comfortable walk to Union Square

review.title: "Great location, very clean"
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Hotel Diva was 7 nights for vacation purposes. The staff who welcomed us was very courteous and helpful as well as other employees, in particular Richard the concierge. Our reservation was for a room with two double beds and during the checked in, we were informed that we would grant an upgrade room. The room was very clean at all times, as well the bathroom. Everyday we receive refill of coffee and water. In addition the hotel has internet available 24/7, lounge with tea and microwave. One of the biggest advantages of this hotel is its location, in the heart of Union Square which greatly facilitated us to get to places of interest, find transportation, etc.. In short, Hotel Diva is a very well located boutique hotel with very clean and accessible facilities, clean rooms with comfortable beds and a very helpful and respectful personnel. I would totally recommend it and if return to San Francisco, I would not hesitate to book again with the Hotel Diva.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean rooms and bathroom with hot water always, comfortable beds, courteous staff
review.locationRemarks: Excellent!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Love the decor. Bathroom was tiny but was fine. Staff were very friendly and eager to assist. Would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom size. Old elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Ok - great access to union square thus to tour buses & cable car.

review.title: Very good location, easy to move around. Great
review.reviewText: We spent 4 days and managed to visit the entire city

review.title: Very Unique!!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay at Hotel Diva. Very unique room with a desk and table set. Much more fun than a big hotel chain. If your looking for something simple, clean and unique then Hotel Diva is perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: They will hold your bags for you if you arrive before check-in and also at check-out they will hold them. They also let us check-in a little early.
review.negativeRemarks: They lighting at the sink area needs to be improved
review.locationRemarks: The location is near Union Square and a block away from the Trolley.

review.title: Definitely recommenD
review.reviewText: Lovely experience. Staff wonderful and friendly (especially Eileen). We booked a standard room and it was our first standard room of our holiday that didn't have a king bed. Probably for the best though as the room was quite small (typical of San Fran I think though). Location was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of standard roo
review.locationRemarks: So close to everything

review.title: Cute hotel in the middle of everything!
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful and cheerful staff addressed our questions and gave us a map to help us get oriented.

review.title: Great funky boutique hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our 3 night stay at Hotel Diva. We have no criticism, only positives! The elevators had funky blue lighting and they host happy Saki hour in the lobby in the afternoons. The room was well appointed and the bed was super comfortable. We were in a junior suite so we had a bit more room. The cool-looking window shades hid the view (which was of another hotel room window and the alley) yet let light in. A second blind darkened the room at night. It was a quiet hotel, yet close to everything. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

review.title: I'll stay there again.
review.reviewText: Great location. Comfortable room. Great decor. Staff was extremely pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Edgy hotel and location
review.reviewText:
Location: Ground Zero in the theater district, adjacent to Union Square (high-end shopping, mostly chains) and the Tenderloin (startlingly aggressive panhandlers). Not close to the Mission, SOMA, the Castro, or the bay but lots of MUNI options.

We had a plumbing problem in our first room and had to move, so we experienced two rooms. Staff was responsive and helped us move. Yes, the basic rooms are tiny, and so are the elevators. This is normal for large cities in which space comes at a premium (SF, NYC). Beds were firm and comfortable with good linens. Good showers, windows opened. Could hear activity in the halls but not in adjacent rooms. Hotel theme, layout, amenities, and arrangement make it a poor choice for those traveling with kids of any age. Good for couples, individuals, and small groups of adults who want a lively, edgy location.
review.positiveRemarks: Room design: Belle Epoch meets 21st century industrialism.
review.negativeRemarks: Loud music in lobby, location.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: other than the occasional noise it's a perfect place. the room isn't too big but enough. staff is friendly and fantastic.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great. It is one block away from union square and many good restaurants are within few-minute walking distance. Staff are very friendly and helpful. You can tell the building is old, but the rooms have been renovated and are stylish. The refrigerator of our room did not work when we first moved in. After we told the front desk they replaced it with a new one like immediately. We had a great time staying and definitely recommend it to everyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, stylish look, friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: One block away from union square, many good restaurants within walking distance

review.title: Good location adequate accommodation.noisy at nigh
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great position near Union Square.
But it is noisy at night ie garbage truck at 4 am for half an hour plus other sleep disturbing noise. The rooms are cheaply furnished. There is veneer of " arty" but it did not appeal to me.
The rooms are small but clean.the bathroom is closet size.
No breakfast room bar or restaurant.
The staff are friendly and helpful.
I would recommend it for position ans staff friendliness and helpfulness.
It is not luxurious if that is what you agree looking for.
It is adequate.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise ans size of the rooms. No restaurant or breakfast room. No room service.
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Diva Seal of Approval
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, the complimentary sake happy hour was a really nice touch to my first impression of the hotel. Concierge recommended nearby restaurants and places to see, which was super helpful. Room was spotless and perfect for a diva. Great concierge service. Generous staff offered several bags of chocolate as I was checking out. It was unexpected, but brightened my day! I'd definitely recommend this hotel to friends who are planning to visit San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from the street carried up to my room on the top floor. insomnia.

review.title: Fun change for business traveler
review.reviewText: Starbucks next door. Fun additions that made it special and funky. No downsides for this business traveler.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We had a great time in San Francisco and part of that was the comfort of knowing we were going back to a hotel that was comfortable with a great staff.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location. Easy access to transportation to explore San Francisco.

review.title: Best Hotel in SF!
review.reviewText: Such a great hotel! Amazing location, good price, very clean rooms and bathrooms! LOVED the style of this hotel. Would definitely stay here again!!! +++++
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Great location, very close to Union square shopping, and Muni/BART station!

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: Great staff. Very pleasant and helpful. Elevators need to be upgraded as it was dark and sometimes smelly. Overall a good place to stay downtown-close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: elevator
review.locationRemarks: Good, right downtown location.

review.title: Good hotel, but still room for improvements
review.reviewText:
PROS

1. Friendly and helpful staff
2. Good location
3. Tastefully decorated room
4. A fridge with nothing in it (we usually buy from outside anyway. Who actually eat & drink from the hotel's mini bar?)

CONS

1. Hear the garbage truck collecting garbage at 5 in the morning
2. Usually short bed. I'm only 5'7" and my feet are sticking out a bit.
3. The blinds, even though equipped with a blackout shade, lets sunlight in along the sides.
review.negativeRemarks: Short beds
review.locationRemarks: Block & a half from Union Square. Three & a half blocks from Westfield Center

review.title: Perfect for a girls trip!
review.reviewText: Awesome if you are doing a girls trip. The Diva theme is so much fun, The room was small but chic and adorable. There are also cute lounges on each floor. If you bring a car you have to valet because there are street restrictions. Starbucks off the lobby!

review.title: great modern hotel
review.reviewText: the hotel is very cute small and modern and the staff was very friendly good place to stay

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Good location. Nice room. Comfy bed. Not great sound proofing between rooms

review.title: Funky Good
review.reviewText: I wasn't quite sure what to expect, given the location--adjacent to Union Square but kind of on the edge of the Tenderloin. I needn't have worried. This is a very funky hotel, but in an entirely positive way. Out front, they have created their own walk of fame (of well-known people who have stayed there). It's directly across from two legitimate theaters if that's your thing and just a block from Union Square if it's shopping. I was in SF on business and needed access to Muni...it was only a few blocks from the Powell St. Station. The hotel itself is delightful. There is no lobby to speak of but that is more than compensated by a number of very interesting--and yes, funky, with 2 story ceilings--little lounges, one on every floor. The rooms are clean and comfortable and although not the largest in SF, they are by no means tiny or the smallest rooms in the city. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Well located, clean and comfortable, friendly service, "positive funkiness"
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Union Square/on the edge of the Tenderloin (if walking from Market Street, approach on Mason rather than Taylor!)

review.title: Would Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a very central location, Short walk to Union Square and all the action Downtown. Heaps of quality restaurants within a short walk too. Small bathroom, but does the job.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and professional. Room was very clean and the decor was a pleasant surprise. The bed was comfortable and pillows were amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, decor, Starbucks next door & friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No refrig
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Good value and location, but noisy
review.reviewText: Great location, Colibri Mexican next door is delicious, plus Starbucks located in the same building. We booked a Queen with Murphy Bed, but there wasn't on ready when we arrived, so they "upgraded" us to a King Suite. The room was large, two sinks, and very nice on Wedsnesday night,but as it came to the weekend it got noisier and noisier. The staff was very nice in letting us know which rooms are quieter, so be sure to ask. We will request a courtyard view room for our next stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful shopping and wide variety of restaurants, safe walk to Uniom Square

review.title: modern rooms, really liked it!
review.reviewText: very nice renovation. We liked the modern theme of the rooms. room was clean. staff nice and friendly.

review.title: Ikea Hotel
review.reviewText: we spent 3 days in SF at Diva. Clean but very cheap furniture (ikea) I would expect more from this hotel. Walls are very thin and elevators were down 80% of the time we were there. I kept asking to move or upgrade but they kept giving me the round around. The only thing nice is the hot coco in the mornings in the lobby.

review.title: Great Hotel...Parking is way over priced!
review.reviewText: For the price (140) this was a great hotel. They should tell you in big bold letters that the parking is 40 plus tax a night. That was the only downfall of this hotel. I would stay again except this time I will park my car in the parking lot down the street for 25 a night.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Good location, good value for money for San Francisco. Only downside was the very noisy air conditioning/heating unit.

review.title: A great place to stay!
review.reviewText:
Very friendly staff with great recommendations for drinks and apps.
Bed was very comfortable and room was very clean.
Popular restaurant on one side of lobby and Starbucks on the other side!
And close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: One light in bathroom sink/mirror was out.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent!

review.title: An all-round fun and functional hotel
review.reviewText:
Right from approaching the hotel (with its celeb handprints in the pavement), Diva hits you as funky and fun. But it's practical as well: free wireless internet, adjoining Starbucks and great Mexican restaurant (Colibri); good quality toiletries, super-quiet rooms at the back of the hotel, early evening complimentary sake in the lobby, excellent central location. A terrific contrast to the Clift diagonally opposite, too pretentious for its own good, where the rooms are probably four times the price of Diva.

Only downside I'd say is that with no ventilation in the tiny bathrooms, there will be mould accumulation in no time. But not yet!

review.title: Great location and Comfortable rooms!
review.reviewText:
Really cute hotel in an excellent location with friendly staff, a starbucks attached and a comfortable room.............ideal for short stay!
I wouldn't recommend it for a week but for a long weekend it's ideal as a base to explore the city.The reviews I read made it sound like the rooms were tiny but mine was a nice size and well decorated etc......... I'd def stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: The room, the shower (!) and the staff
review.negativeRemarks: None - it was great!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for exploring SF

review.title: Simply...I will go back!
review.reviewText: Comfortable, convenient location, spectacular district.
review.negativeRemarks: Guest services
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Fun place
review.reviewText: Adorable hotel just on the small side. Still loved it though.
review.negativeRemarks: Too small
review.locationRemarks: Great area

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location and is well kept. The room is slightly tight, but not uncomfortable.

review.title: A fashion Hotel.
review.reviewText:
The Hotel location is excellent. I loved the Hotel's concept.
The mustiness in the toillet was unpleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: The odor in the toillet.
review.locationRemarks: Great.

review.title: Thanks to Hotel Diva!
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva was in an excellent location and we were able to access most of everything on our to do list! We had a fabulous time while we were in San Francisco!!
review.positiveRemarks: It was small, intimate and had personality.
review.negativeRemarks: There were interesting events and people characters that took place outside the hotel(i.e. homeless and brawl from theater guests across the street)
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to walk to various districts and hop on the cable car, etc.

review.title: Stylish and Clean
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for 3 nights on Tahnksgiving on expedia. When I arrived, the staff had my reservation and there was no hassle at all. The room was great, very modern and stylish. Every once in a while I could hear someone outside, but the noise level was minimal. For a boutique hotel, I found it very clean and comfortable, especially for the price. Parking is a bit pricey ($36/day), but from what I researched, still under most of the hotels in the area. Would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: modern and stylish design of rooms
review.negativeRemarks: parking fee
review.locationRemarks: location was great. Close to busses and cable cars, restaurants and bars.

review.title: Comfortable, Great Customer Service & Location!
review.reviewText:
Visiting San Francisco for the first time with my wife, we were looking for somewhere central to stay. The Hotel was well situated, walking distance from the main City Centre and AMC Movie Theatres...perfect for shopping or catching a movie!

The Diva Staff were very friendly and helpful, had plenty of great advice on local attractions and yummy places to eat.

FREE WiFi to keep in touch with family & friends, facebook status updates ;-) also a added bonus was FREE access to a computer & printer, great for printing tickets/vouchers for booked tours. (The previous hotel we stayed in Las Vegas, wanted to charge us $8 USD to print one A4 Page :-S)

The bed was very comfortable and clean. The only slight negative, the room was a little squishy...but we did have x6 suitcases for all our shopping ;-D

Would definitely stay here again and recommend to family, friends and business colleagues!
review.negativeRemarks: room was a little squishy
review.locationRemarks: walking distance from the main City Centre & AMC Movie Theatres...perfect for shopping or catching a Movie!

review.title: A fun stay, but...
review.reviewText:
We stayed there over a weekend and stayed in a room on the second floor facing the street. The street noise was incredible. Car horns, police/fire sirens, people yelling to each other, cars riding down the street with music playing as loud as a dance club. I don't know what was going on because everything on the street was closed. The noise lasted until around 2 a.m. The next morning there was lots of trash in the gutter. This happened Friday night and Saturday night. Sunday night was a lot better. (Yes, I have stayed in a large city before...this was loud!)

The staff was great and the room was fun and very clean. A lamp in our room had a short and they replaced it within 5 minutes of my request. The LED black lights in the elevator was a nice touch.

They say they will retrieve you car in 20 minutes but in reality give them a 60 minute heads-up. We would call for the car and go have breakfast down the street. The car would be ready when we got back.

It's a good location for activities and shopping...just get an inside room or a room on a higher room.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise
review.locationRemarks: Lots of thinks to do just a few blocks away.

review.title: Thoroughly Recommend
review.reviewText: Stayed twice in the last week. Excellent location and room. Top internet service.
review.negativeRemarks: Nil
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: hotel diva
review.reviewText: I called the week before to request a king room, I am pregnant and my husband is very tall. When we checked in there were no king rooms for several days. The first queen room we stayed in was extremely loud and facing the street, had a hole in the wall in the bathroom and no blowdryer. After a night of not sleeping we requested a new room. The second queen room was better and I would recommend switching if possible immediately instead of having a sleepless night. The location is great, and the staff were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: loud room, small sizes
review.locationRemarks: union square, prime spot

review.title: Pretty good for relative price
review.reviewText: given prices in this area, it's a pretty good hotel
review.positiveRemarks: free drinks during happy hour, good beds
review.negativeRemarks: loud room (over fitness area), non-working lights, missing fixtures in shower and fluctuating water temperature
review.locationRemarks: on the edge of Tenderloin, bit sketchy at night

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: I was really hoping that the hotel staff at the front desk were a little more helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable after a long day of biking
review.negativeRemarks: Thee front desk could have been a little better with directions
review.locationRemarks: the location was okay, a couple of blocks from all the shopping and action. Safe, quiet(for a city) and easy to find

review.title: Hotel Diva
review.reviewText: The hotel Diva is convenient to all downtown attractions. It is two blocks west of Union Square on Geary. It's location, in my opinion, however good to access the city centre, is just on the cusp of a not so nice part of town - homeless people and constant street beggars. The homeless food shelters are found in this area as well. I never had a problem but any further west on Geary would not be advised. That said, I found the hotel to be clean and welcoming. The elevators are slow but didn't seem to be well used. I took the stairs being on the third floor. The hotel is an old renovated building- like many in San Fransisco. The room was small but being out all day seeing the sites - who cares! I would recommend an inner room (i.e. not facing the street). The narrow streets in this area amplify street traffic, not to mention the constant sirens. Only real compliant was the 3:00 am garbage pick up. My room had a small window overlooking over an alley and the building directly opposite. Other than that I had a great week in San Fransisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, convenient, inexpensive (as compared to others in the same area), nice staff
review.negativeRemarks: 3: 00 am garbage pick-up, small rooms (particularly the bathroom)
review.locationRemarks: Great location - centre of the action at Union Square, close to China town and Market street and both the BART and public transit (MUNI)

review.title: Great hotel for a weekend .
review.reviewText: Everything was great except for the shower; the shower head needs to be changed. Great for a weekend. The room could be small for a couple but perfect for a single. The location is fabulous. The service was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Friendly staff and great location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is great - good proximity to shopping, nightlife, cable cars. The staff is warm and friendly. Not a lot of frills but a great little hotel find.

review.title: Nice hotel but it might be on the decline
review.reviewText: Bathroom was very, very small and there was hair in the bathtub...not mine. Also, the bathrobe had a decent size hole in it. Overall, the staff was friendly but the upkeep of the hotel and room could be better.
review.negativeRemarks: Hair in the bathtub and very small bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Location was several blocks from BART stop

review.title: Hotel Diva
review.reviewText: Housekeeping knocked on the door at 9 AM. A bit early even if we didn't have the do not disturb hanger out. Only 1 washcloth in the room. Otherwise, a cool little place to stay in spite of being quite pricy for the size of the room.

review.title: Amazing Location
review.reviewText: I loved the look and decorations of the place. The room was nice and clean. The beds were amazingly comfortable! The bathroom was a bit smaller than I expected, but the shampoo and conditioner provided was excellent. The hotel smelled really good, and was clean and well kept. The customer service was very decent. The lady that checked us in was a bit robotic, but over all, I have no complaints.
review.positiveRemarks: The smell! The cleanliness, the decorations and location, location, location!
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms were a bit small, but I really have nothing bad to say.

review.title: Great location but just an OK hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva on the whole was an ok hotel. The location was excellent as it was close to Union Square, excellent shopping and the cable cars. The room on the whole was acceptable. comfortable beds and pillows, plenty of clean towels and the murphy bed in our room was superior to any pull out that we could have asked for. The draw backs to the room were that there was inadequate lighting, which made it very hard to get ready in the morning when someone else was showering. The bathroom was extremely small with no storage or counter space for toiletries and no fan, making the bathroom and room hot after someone showered. There were only 3 hangers in the closet for 3 people staying in the room. If you wanted a late night soda or juice, the hotel does not have vending machines and you must walk to the Walgreen's if you wanted such sundries. The hotel staff was adequately polite and helpful, especially when asking for driving directions. Maid service could have been better as our bedspread was dirty and dirty glasses were never removed or replaced during our 5 day stay.
review.negativeRemarks: inadequate room lighting and lack of bathroom fan

review.title: Nice hotel with a great location.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel!! Great location! Little noisy but all good. Room had a murphy bed that I did not need but nice for party who might.
review.negativeRemarks: Room ok for me personally
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Not as cool as the website photos but ok
review.reviewText: Clean, great downtown location, streetsounds could be noisy, gray color palette, not as upscale as website makes it look, great beds and sheets.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Small room but clean and in a great location. Just a block from
Union square. Has starbucks and few fast food restaurant just next to the hotel. Staff were helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Rooms small but clean and comfortable. Staff friendly and very helpful.

review.title: Great hotel for couples! Sleek, sexy & convenient
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva has a very sleek, streamlined appearance, the entry area smells amazing albeit small. We stayed for 5 nights- our room was small but the bathroom was much larger than expected - the complimentary toiletries were great and eco-friendly. The fitness area was great and we were very thankful for the business lounge because there was a computer with complimentary printer usage. Also, there was sake in the lobby every evening - bonus! There were only 2 negatives with our stay; the first evening we were there we were jet lagged and tired and there was a DJ in the room directly above ours for a Perrier event. It was painfully loud and so annoying to a tired traveler, I don't remember what time it ended - pretty early (9 p.m. or so) but we were unfortunately irritated by it. The second negative - since we had prepaid with Expedia they needed to put a hold on our credit card. They said they would hold $50 but actually put a hold on $1,250! When I discovered this over halfway into our stay I brought it to the attention of the staff and was told it would be corrected and "I hope you didn't need the money for shopping!? Because if so - we can just fix it right now." Well, I did not need the credit line in fact - but if I had, I would have found that embarrassing; they did immediately fix the extra-large hold but I never once received an apology or a free night of parking or any extra perk because of their mistake. Otherwise - it was a great stay in a super cool, clean hotel!!
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the business lounge area with the complimentary printing, loved the iPod dock in the room, the large bathrooms, the linens, lobby smelled great!
review.negativeRemarks: With their one mistake I received no apology, no bonus of any sort. It was definitely corrected immediately but there was no extra hospitality.
review.locationRemarks: Just 1-2 blocks up from the heart of Union Square - close to all public transit, many cafes, restaurants, bars & fabulous shopping.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good location, friendly staff and the room was comfortable

review.title: Great hotel for location and bed comfort
review.reviewText:
The wife and I just returned from our 1 week stay in SF at the Diva. Overall we had a good experience.

Things we liked about the hotel:
1. Staff friendly and helpful
2. Overall very clean well kept hotel & comfortable beds
3. Great central location a couple of blocks away from Union Square

Things we didn't like about the hotel:
1. Noise through ceilings (not walls) when people above us were stomping around (we were on the 3rd floor). Not sure why they were walking so much, usually when you're at a hotel, you are there to lay down and rest from your busy day.

I can't really blame this on the hotel as it is an old building that had been renovated and it is what it is. We just happen to have the unfortunate experience of elephants above us roaming around at all hours of the night.
review.positiveRemarks:
1. Clean rooms
2. Comfortable beds
3. Great location
review.negativeRemarks: Noise coming through the ceiling
review.locationRemarks: Great central location!

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Right in front of the thearter and within walking distance to union square. Great location but typically small space for SF area hotel.

review.title: Awesome choice!
review.reviewText: Awesome location and great staff - very friendly and eager to help you out. Great having the Starbucks off the lobby! Room was a bit small for me and my son - but the beds were super comfy and everything was clean. Hotel is cool - but the elevators are super slow and one of them was almost always out of service. Totally recommended!

review.title: Really, it was fine....
review.reviewText:
They were in the process of fixing the elevators while we were there. Some waiting and some walking up and down stairs.

Our room had no cell phone connection. Had to walk to the window of the fire escape to get a signal.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator / cell phone issues.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Walk to cable car, BART, bars, restaurants, Union Square, etc

review.title: Lots of Germans and French
review.reviewText: The main elevator was out and so we had to walk the floors most of the time or wait 10 or more minutes for the one small one that went to the basement everytime before taking you to your floor.
review.positiveRemarks: upgraded to a suite and good service
review.negativeRemarks: elevator was out
review.locationRemarks: close to union square

review.title: great hotel for couples
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect......until the morning without HOT WATER, when temperature in summer in San Francisco was 50 to 60 degrees
review.locationRemarks: in the best street of SF, full of art galleries and designer stores , and a few blocks from UnionSquare

review.title: Disappointing accomodations.
review.reviewText: The hotel has two small elevators. During our entire 4 night stay, only one elevator was in working condition. During the day, hotel staff had to use the elevator so that there was rarely room for us to use it even when we waited for it. In the mornings there were too many people trying to use the elevator. Although we were on the 7th floor, we had to use the stairs 80% of the time. Many other guests also resorted to using the stairs. On Sunday afternoon there was no hot water. We were advised that the hot water would not be restored until after 10:00 am on Monday. We had to leave for the airport before the hot water was restored. The hotel staff offered to make arrangements for us to take showers at another hotel about 2 blocks away. We expected better accommodations for the cost and the ratings.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the hotel was convenient to Union Square shopping and dining.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators and lack of hot water.
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent for shopping and dining.

review.title: small and cozy
review.reviewText: moderate room theme and clean very quite to the area the it located safe and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: not a very picky person found the place clean.
review.locationRemarks: located close to the shopping center of down town nod hill but still the room are very quite

review.title: The 60th birthday hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel is located perfect near food , shopping and we even walked to AT&T ballpark! The American Conservatory Theater is right across the street. We watched The Scottsboro Boys, had great seats for $25. I liked the tea room and the Perrier water when you walk in the hotel front door. Will stay next year at "The Diva"!
review.positiveRemarks: The room was big and clean. Room 616
review.negativeRemarks: Needed to call for wash cloths
review.locationRemarks: Great location..near everything

review.title: Great location!! Very friendly staff!!
review.reviewText: The location of Hotel Diva was fantastic!! It is close to Union Square & many great places to eat!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Diva for over 15 years. Always great!
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Great hotel for downtown!
review.reviewText: Staff was great, and would do anything we ask. Rooms are small, but pleasant. We spent most of our time traveling around San Francisco. We enjoyed the hotel and staff very much. We would stay again, as rates were also reasonable and we could afford them.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room, but adequate.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Minutes walk from Union square and BART. Great location, lots of restaurants, in the heart of shopping district and 20-30mins away from major San Fran tourist hotspot
review.positiveRemarks: Great ocation, interesting boutique theme hotel, friendly staff and free wifi
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator is a bit slow but I can live with that.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, minutes walk from Union Square and BART station. In the heart of shopping district, under 30mins bus ride to major tourist hotspots.

review.title: Valet
review.reviewText: hotel was great. took about an hour to get my car from vallet and them returning it with mud on my wheels and my rims bent and scraped on the side and yet i still had to pay the $50 dollars.

review.title: Really pleased!! Stay here.
review.reviewText: I was really happy and satisfied with the hotel. Staff were really helpful, ideal location and room was not tiny like others I have stayed at in the same area.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, location, comfort. Reasonably priced restaurant next door.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic. Lots of options for food and drink close by, try the diners at the corner and the ramen noodle place 2 doors down.

review.title: Excellent stay!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very accomodating and helpful around directions and transportation to and from the airport. We arrived a few hours before check in and were accomodated almost immediately with a very clean and comfortable room. Friendly staff both at the desk as well as throughout the hotel, being greeted happily by every staff we met. Thanks for a great stay! Will come back anytime and recommend your hotel to friends!
review.positiveRemarks: staff were always happy to greet us and help out with whatever needs we had
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit small but manageable for a couple. Bathroom was a comfortable size for two.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Walked to the market, the wharf and the ball park. Long walks but enjoyable.

review.title: Diva Hotel is unique
review.reviewText: Hotel was very chic and cool. Great vibe and decor. Starbucks connected to hotel which was key. Great place to stay for couples, business or just visiting the city by yourself. Location is great and near union plaza, great high end designer clothes shopping, the subway, bus station, theater, bars/places to eat etc.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a strike at a hotel 2 buildings down. The picketers woke us up 2 mornings in a row chanting through a megaphone. Windows are not sound proof
review.locationRemarks: Location very central to many attractions. Many other attractions within walking distance (if you don't mind a 15-30 minute walk). Beautiful city.

review.title: Overall good experiece, though...
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great, close to everything. The room is small but very specially decorated and I like the style very much. The only thing I am not pleased with is that the bath tap kept leaking during my stay. I asked room service to fix it, which however was not actually fixed. It was a little bothering when hearing water leaking the whole night.
review.negativeRemarks: bath tap and the bathroom (too small)
review.locationRemarks: great!

review.title: The roving Kiwi
review.reviewText:
We loved the location of the Hotel and the service of the staff. Virgil is extremely impressive and very attentive and empathetic. He and all the front desk staff were exceptional - they made our trip. The taxi to the airport was smoothly arranged by Bob and we loved the comfort of the limousine. Hotel cleaning and maintenance staff very efficient as well.

I would love to write more but we have just arrived back in NZ after a long flight...

Keep up the good work, Diva
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: brilliant

review.title: Great hotel, despite breakfast not included.
review.reviewText: It was great. Perfect location, amazing quality, style and finish of both the room and the rest of 'the hotel. Only one problem was that the window wouldn't close properly and anyway it was single-glazed so a bit of draft and noise was coming in. This didn't affect at all my stay, although maybe it would have if I was more fussy about the noise.

review.title: Great For Couples On The Artsy Side!
review.reviewText: This was the BEST hotel...we enjoyed 3 great nights! Location, service and accommodations were superior! One of the best nights sleep in California! Will visit this hotel again!

review.title: it was just ok didnt think it was a 3.5
review.reviewText: clean place,nice room.very small bathroom.did i mention the bathroom was small.kind of on the noisy side.it was just ok,no parking,cost me a 40 spot/night

review.title: Great stay at Hotel Diva
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location in Union Square 2 blocks away from the trolley. Staff was very accommodating and helpful when trying to book excursions and recommending restuarants.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to trolley.

review.title: Delightful Diva
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend in March of 2012. The staff were friendly and courteous, though we did not ask for any special services or request directions or ask for area recommendations regarding restaurants, entertainment or shopping. Our room was clean and presented nicely with comfortable mattress and bedding. My boyfriend was the first to shower and the drainage in the bathtub was virtually non-existent. It was enough for me to not want to stay there again, however, the next time he showered there was no problem with the drainage or water pressure at all. It could have been that the stopper was partially closed, but we couldn't figure out what the issue was. Since it remedied itself, I would stay here again. Plenty of coffee shops and restaurants in close proximity, as well as liquor stores and drug stores. Union square close by. Lots of transit options as well. Very walkable area.

review.title: Cute
review.reviewText:
The location is great, only you have to watch were you go one you leave the hotel. One wrong turn and it gets a bit sketchy.
The hotel staff were amazing, SO helpful.

review.title: My Diva experience.
review.reviewText:
I found the elevator lighting to be calming.
The staff was very pleasant and helpful.
The housekeeping staff were effective.
review.negativeRemarks: Well San Fran pick up garbage at 3am and it is easily rectified by asking for an inside room.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient, convenient and did i say convenient.

review.title: Would recommend it.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is centrally located. The room was small but comfortable. The hotel in general was clean. It is not a fancy hotel but it is good enough.

I would not hesitate to stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: extremely small, not worth it at all
review.reviewText: Very very small and not the cleanest, I would not stay here again.

review.title: Great location! Cute hotel!
review.reviewText: Hotel is located right off Union Square Plaza. I was a little worried after reading reviews, but I really loved my room. It was very neat and clean, and I loved the decor. I read on here to request a room with a king because the rooms were bigger. I asked when I checked in if I could have a king and they gladly moved me. My bathroom was larger than expected. The sake in the lobby in the evenings is quite nice, also. I was very pleased with this hotel and would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located about and block and a half from Union Square Plaza. It's just blocks away from some great restaurants and shopping!

review.title: Good price for the location, on busy street.
review.reviewText: We were a little early for check-in but our room was ready. Room was small but not cramped and suited us well enough for a five night stay. The bathroom was tiny, definitely a one person room, with no place to keep toiletry bags. Great hot water supply and water pressure, good quality toiletries supplied. Poor selection of tv channels with some very poor reception on two of them. Wifi worked well. Concierge was very helpful, booked a wine tour and gave good restaurant advice. I had requested a room on a quiet side but got one in front on Geary. Very very noisy street. City pressure washed the sidewalks at midnight. Come on people, guests are trying to sleep! Hotel Frank in the next block has a union dispute on going so expect protestors with megaphones. Was woken one morning at 7:00 to the noise. Connecting doors in the lobby to Starbucks and Mexican restaurant. Try the restaurant for good authentic (not Taco Bell) food. Good location for transit and designer brand shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from Geary Street
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square so right in the designer fashion shopping area.

review.title: Comfortable with good location.
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel. Very convenient location. Streetside room can be noisy.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise on street side room.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Hotel Diva
review.reviewText: Good price, very nice staff. The ambiance is a little too art-deco for our tastes, but we'd definitely stay again.

review.title: Great value for a spacious, stylish room
review.reviewText: We have stayed here before in an exterior room, but the noise from Geary and Mason can be intrusive. This time, we stayed in an interior room overlooking the airshaft -- not much to look at, but boy did we sleep great. Nice rooms, very spacious, decent wifi -- all in all, very pleasant with no complaints.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very small reception area, meeting rooms scattered over a few floors. Great connecting door to Satrbucks, great location. Smallish rooms but very well done.
review.negativeRemarks: VERY small reception area
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Diva,Union Square
review.reviewText:
Located just off of Union Square made it easy to get around.My room was compact but comfortable.
Points off for television picture quality,but added for attitude.This hotel is part of the Personality Hotels chain which seemed to be a plus.
Starbucks is connected to the hotel.
Great value/cost ratio.Plenty of opportunity for fine dining and entertainment within walking distance.
Try Powell Street for a great cardio workout;up towards Pier 39,not down to Market.
I enjoyed it.

review.title: A bit on the dark side
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in an older building. Many windows go into dark alleys or onto fire escapes. Together with the (supposedly fancy, I guess) dark gray/silver color scheme the hotel is pretty dark. My small room looked more like a cave than a room. The fishnet stocking theme is questionable, but didn't bother me too much, though it gets old staring at a pair of female legs in every window.

The room was small, but had everything needed, the bed was firm and I slept well. Since my window went out into the back alley noise was not an issue either

review.title: Great break
review.reviewText: Really helpful staff.

review.title: San Francisco Sleeper
review.reviewText: Just one block away from Union Square in the heart of the Theater District, this 7 floor ultra modern hotel was a real surprise for our family. Bathrooms are tiny but there is plenty of room and nice amenities like robes, slippers and a refrigerator. Perfect for the business traveler or family leisure getaway at half the price of the major hotels. May not be good for those who want or need in hotel dining but their is plenty of excellent restaurants within a short walk. Join their hotel club for free and get a very nice present on arrival too. I am looking to go back to the Diva soon.

review.title: Good location, service needs help!
review.reviewText: You cannot beat the location of this hotel, less than 2 blocks from Union Square on a pretty safe street. For a San Francisco room, it was larger however, although newly remodeled, the floors are paper thin. We could hear the people walking above us. The air conditioner/heater was very noisy (old), even on a low setting it squeeked. Although we paid for 4 people in the room, we never got enough towels and had to ask. Lighting in the room is poor, tv remote didn't work. Bed was very comfortable, location of room was facing an alley which made it less noisy than the street noise nearby. I would stay at this hotel if the price was adjusted for these faults. Overpriced when compared to what we experienced. Prices need to be adjusted or fix the problems.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva advertises itself as a sexy location. Maybe the condom left in the room safe was supposed to elevate it to these heights! The staff were pleasant and helpful. I suggest that the hotel would be an ideal venue for a weekend break. We stayed for 4 days and the hotel did not have the facilities to comfortably cater for this type of guest. The room had a constant buzz from the air conditioning. Ifound it difficult to sleep.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Good location - good value - staff very helpful
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful - responded to questions and requests readily. Location is good. Comfort of room - certainly acceptable. Room was small - sink was in bedroom - heat a challenge to control - it was either too hot or chilly. However, it was very quiet - no noise from outside or other rooms. Bed was very comfortable. I would stay here again...

review.title: Small rooms but great service
review.reviewText: The room was very small and the bathroom was tiny also but the customer service was fantastic as well as the location

review.title: Comforable and convenient place next to Union Square
review.reviewText: I've really enjoyed my stay at Diva: the room was very comfortable and well put together, and the location was central and convenient (not a very nice neighborhood though). There was no view from the windows in my room at all: they are directly facing the windows of the other wing of the hotel a few meters across, so the windows have to be shaded at all times. Wasn't a problem for me, just wanted to warn those for whom it might be important. I'd give it 4.5 stars, would be happy to stay there again.

review.title: Not impressed, but not bad
review.reviewText: Awesome location, great hotel for the price, but if you are looking for a extraordinary place to stay, this is not it.

review.title: Diva is divine!
review.reviewText: The Diva Hotel is very well maintained, staff is wonderful, the office facilities for guests is perfect and the decor was fun. I was extrememly happy here.

review.title: Best thing is everything is outside the door but....
review.reviewText: I stayed here after a night of partying for my birthday. I love the whole modernized look and feel of the lobby as for the rooms. The only complaints that I made clear at the front desk was that my AC did not work. Luckily the fan mode worked but the low setting was broken so I had to put up with a very loud and annoying "HUMMMM" sound all night. Poor plumming. The water ran all night in the bathtub even after tightening the knob. I called room service for extra towels in the morning. It took about an hour before anyone came and I already had a shower and decided to just air dry. Besides those three complaints the beds and linen where very comfortable. Valet from the hotel took about 20 mins which wasn't bad since you can kill some time at the Starbucks attached to the lobby. In my on opinion, It's worth a night but I wouldn't extend my stay. Btw, Kevin Spacey is performing a stage act across the street. I forgot which play it was though...

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Smaller style boutique place - very nice - albeit smaller rooms. Good location - near Union Sq - nice staff.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, rooms a bit small
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Diva on business, the room was an interior room and was small. The furnishings were very modern, primarily using decorative steel with Oak tops. The room was small but by all measures comfortable, quiet and well maintained. I would not hesitate to stay here again, providing the price is right.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Location location location. San Francisco is easy enough to get around by bus, but Hotel Diva had lots to offer within walking distance. Union square is just down the street (great shopping), Chinatown is a few blocks away, and we walked up to the north shore and Fishermans Wharf in about 20 minutes. Also, it's about 2 blocks from a BART stop, which makes travel to and from the airport a breeze. I would definitely recommend this charming, though small, hotel to anyone looking for an average priced hotel room with a great location.

review.title: Super cool hotel dude
review.reviewText: The first hinge you notice are the blue diode lights in the elevator. The rooms are tiny but it makes up with sheer style and art.

review.title: Viva la Hotel Diva!
review.reviewText: Always stay at Hotel Diva, love location, style, good value, etc. etc. etc. No negatives!

review.title: Great location and comfortable bed
review.reviewText:
This hotel is just one block from Union Square. It has Starbucks next door and a stand-in-line-because-it-is-worth-it- ramen/sushi restaurant on the other side.
Rooms are small, but that is all right because the bed is comfortable and room is clean. Bathroom is small and clean, too. Nice touch to have lounges to read in, internet, sit and chat. Business center to print out pages from the internet as well.
Front desk staff were all very helpful. Would stay again.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed for 5 nights and it was a great stay. There are many restaurants, cafes, and shopping all within blocks of the hotel. If you like Starbucks, there is one in the hotel. The staff was VERY courteous and friendly. We were very happy with the cleanliness of our room and the cleaning staff was great. Beds were always nicely made up for us and room nice tidy. I look forward to visiting again when we're back in San Francisco.

review.title: For perfect location with diva style
review.reviewText: Checkin and checkout was made super simple which is much appreciated from normally waiting at other hotels. Quirky concept but the location and service makes up for the name

review.title: Decent Hotel but
review.reviewText: Very good hotel with only one drawback... The coffee maker, which was missing from room.

review.title: Great Hotel: large, clean, comfortable, inexpensive room
review.reviewText: The theme's a little funny, but for the quality and price it can't be beat

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Everything was great. Staff were helpful and knowledgeable. Hotel room was nice.

review.title: A "Motel 6" with better furniture and service
review.reviewText:
Do not expect too much from this hotel...
I mean... sure, the location is excellent, and people are kind and helpful... they brought me a rollover bed without any additional charge.
But the hotel looks like a "Motel 6" inside, with just better and modern furniture. The floor squeaks while you walk, the bathroom was not very clean, the windows let the cold wind enter the room, and the heater is noisy.
Nevertheless, the hotel is OK for what you pay, plus you get free wireless internet and free coffee or tea in the morning.

review.title: Secondhand Smoke the Entire Time
review.reviewText: The Diva promotes itself as a smoke-free hotel, but during my recent stay, my room was not off the street, but towards the back of the hotel with a window on a breezeway. Every morning and evening my room was inundated with cigarette smoke. Don't know if it came from employees on a lower floor, or if guests were puffing out their windows, but it was gross, bothered my eyes, etc. I'm good with personal freedoms of all kinds, but if a property can't enforce its own rules, why bother? I've stayed at this hotel for 15 years on and off, and am considering not returning.

review.title: Divalicous Hotel Diva
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva was more than what I expected. Booking the Family room for a group of 4 was a good decision on my part. The hotel was clean, though the toilet was quite small (it was like toilets in Japanese hotels). The housekeeping though did not replace used shampoos and body wash regularly. We needed to request for them. There was free coffee and tea in the morning which was quite good. Location is perfect for us since it is located in major downtown stores. Overall, the experience with the Hotel Diva was very good.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Sure, the place looked interesting and conveniently located close to Union Square, but I expected better service and conditions for the price.

We didn't have towels on the first night we arrived, and the front desk said they didn't have anymore but would bring them in the morning by 7:30 a.m. The towels didn't arrive until the afternoon.

Getting parking validation depended on who was behind the front desk. Most times it was not a problem at all, but was treated poorly with one person who would not grant the request unless one parked with their more expensive valet.

Housekeeping was pretty good, but our bathroom had mold everywhere.

review.title: Location and Value
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva was perfect for our needs. I took my twenty-something kids and they loved the modern design. The bed was comfy, our room was quiet. The staff was so helpful, and the location was just the best for being in the hub of so much. Best of all, the rates were reasonable, which gives you more money to spend on things out and about

review.title: Appriopriate PRice for Value of Hotel in SAN FRAN
review.reviewText: Value for price is fair, great location. Front desk could have been more hospitable!

review.title: Great location to Union Square
review.reviewText: location to union square is great. however, use caution (obviously) if out in the wee morning hours. the city's homelessness is apparent.

review.title: Literally, in a NUTSHELL.
review.reviewText: In a nutshell, can be referred to this commentary as well as the hotel. It is rather small and cramped for the amount paid. There was no wifi, not even in the "computer" or "business center." The staff were very polite, accommodating, and nice (including housekeeping). All I can say, the room is small EXTREMELY small.

review.title: Not the Peronality I was looking for.
review.reviewText:
I am a frequent traveller to the US for business and this was my first time in San Fran. The location of this hotel is it's best feature. Near Union Square it was in easy walking of good shops and resturaunts and transport was nearby.

We arrived early and where looking for an early check in. We were told the room wouldn't be ready untill noon, which was fine, but when we did check in my room was messy. Bed unmade and the towels weren't changed. Also, therer was no information on how to call housekeeping or reception as the labelled buttons on the phone didn't work. The phone itself would often require a few pushes of the number for it to work. The King bed was actaully a soft single and a hard single joined together and lacked comfort. On the plus side, when I found housekeeping, they were very quick to fix up my room, but after travelleing for 20+hours, I was really just looking to be able to settle in quickly and relax.

The next morning also, I was woken at 8am by housekeeping entering my room. This was annoying as I didn't hear a knock and woke in a fright with the sound of the door opening as they let themselves in. They where apologetic though.

I don't reccomend the town car or limo, unless you want to pay at least double what a cab would cost you.

Overall, it was bearable for what it was, but I think with so much competition in accomodation in san fran, I'll be looking elsewhere next time.

review.title: Would love to visit again.
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and accommodating in every way!! We loved Hotel Diva location was wonderful it was easy to get to everything we wanted to do and see. It was also quiet at night never heard any noise and i am a light sleeper.

review.title: Outstanding service. Maintenance lacking. Perfect location!
review.reviewText:
The hotel service was outstanding and attentive. The location was superb with lots of good restaurants and shops within walking distance. We even walked to the cable cars and took it to Fisherman's Wharf. Our only complaint was the Air Conditioner worked for maybe 5 minutes at a time, and then blew out hot air. Normally we wouldn't use air in San Francisco in September, but they had a heat wave in the 90s and it was uncomfortable. The hotel staff brought us a fan quickly which helped. We also had a clogged shower drain when we first arrived - not sure how that one got past their cleaning crew. It was unclogged quickly.

I would stay there again, but hopefully get a room in better condition.

review.title: would not go back
review.reviewText:
The hotel needs a lot to TLC maintance. Beds uncomfortable, rooms needed paint and capets needed cleaning.

Location is good for Union Square, staff was friendly.

review.title: Would both recommend and stay there again
review.reviewText:
Excellent staff. Hotel lobby was small but elegant; in general a very nice look and feel to the place. The room lighting was a bit dim, but other than that modern and neat.
Location was perfect. There were lots of street people asking for money after dark -- numerous, but not offensive. Other than that it's a superlative location -- excellent central point from which we visited the entire city (often by taxis which seemed both plentiful and cheap compared to where we live in Europe).

review.title: Bed ruined stay
review.reviewText:
Loved this hotel, everything except our bed. For the last 30 years, we've travelled all over the world & stayed in hundreds of hotels. The bed in our room at this hotel, (with the exception of a hotel bed in Paris in the 70's for which we paid $7 a night), was the absolute worst bed - in the world!

Another thing that left a bad taste in my mouth was the reservation for two king rooms depending on availability turned into one king that was assigned to our travelmates & the doomed queen that was ours even though I had made the reservations in my name.

I'm torn because it's a great hotel but I will never stay there again. Ever.

review.title: Very pleasant
review.reviewText: Our stay at The Diva was as comfortable as can be. Not one complaint. All employers are very nice and helpful.

review.title: San Francisco - Great hotel! will go again.
review.reviewText:
This is a great place to stay - room was brilliant - just like the promo photo - loved the shades! There is a business centre free to use. The staff were helpful and prompt when following up on requests (ie recommendations, booking restaurants, taxi, and a bus tour!). Liked the house car too - good for a splurge.

The location is excellent - pubs, restaurants and clubs close by. Do go to the top floor of Macys (just down the road) - great view and food. The sushi boat restaurant across the road is excellent value.

Take a walk up to Nob Hill - the breathlessness is worth it and Top of the Mark is wonderful for cocktails and views. Check out the Church - amazing stain glass windows.

So much to do - had a ball and would love to go back! Thanks Diva!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Awesome location. Staff is pretty nice. Everything arrived when we requested it.

review.title: so so
review.reviewText: I Love the Diva but I'm sad to say This visit was my least favorite. It came down to the room for me. The blinds are tied so they don't keep out all the light which is irritating. When I told the front desk, they didn't seem to care. The fan in the bathroom ran all day and all night, even closing the door to the bathroom didn't help the sound. Again,told the front desk, not a concern for them. The tv of course the 2 channels I would even consider watching had no sound on them. Again, told the front desk, not a concern. When I checked out, also, no question of if I enjoyed my stay. I was hoping for a apology or a discount of some type, considering all of the complaints were out of my control and they could've done something to make it more comfortable for me.

review.title: The Diva has seen better days
review.reviewText: The Hotel Diva was once a great little boutique hotel in the heart in Union Square. But The Diva is in serious need of a little love and attention. It appears that the rooms have not been upgraded since their last renovation in the mid 90's. Everything is a little rough around the edges: no soap dish at the sink, PPV channels not working, shabby elevators, and bedding that should have been retired many years ago. Bottom line--for the money you can do much, much better in Union Square. Keep shopping until the Diva finally decides that it's to upgrade.

review.title: Guest from Florida
review.reviewText:
Was a great location in downtown area. Nearby to a lot of attractions. Hotel staff is great and helpful.
Only thing, the room didn't have any cellphone signal. And the window opens to a neighbours wall.
Overall had a good experience staying at Hotel Diva. I would recommend it for future travelers.

review.title: Beautiful and Clean
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel with very friendly staff. Great location Close to Shopping, Transport and Restaurants. The rooms were modern, extremely clean and comfortable. Very Satisfied.

review.title: Rude and Mean!
review.reviewText: awful service and response

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Area
review.reviewText: This hotel was extremely affordable, though parking is $40 a night, and only 5 blocks away from the Moscone Center. Good restaurants and good area in the city as well. They made my stay very enjoyable and easy. Definitely a place I'll stay in SF again!

review.title: Would've been great 10 years ago!
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was friendly and helpful! They were able to get us into our rooms early and without any hassle. The rooms on the other hand were less than what I had expected... The velvet pillows were not what you want to find in a hotel and the showers was like stepping into a waterfall... Not to mention that you need to watch out for the shower head flying off mid-shower... The screaming and running through the hallway mixed with the alley-way bum arguements made for an entertaining night, however when you are trying to sleep it gets old! Bottom Line - Go Somewhere Else!

review.title: Great location, great price!
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel and a great location. This is my second time staying here and it was just as great as the first time. The room this time was smaller than before, but what else can you expect in old buildings? There is a starbucks attached to the building which is completely convenient and the location itself is 2 blocks down from union square. The decor is funky and I loved it.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 5 nights at Hotel Diva:
The location of this hotel is awesome!
The hotel staff were friendly and helpful.
The room was well kept and clean.
I felt safe staying there.
Conviently close to Starbucks.

I will stay there again.
(remember to bring ear plugs!)

review.title: Not impressed at all
review.reviewText:
Nice lobby, but the rest is very disapointing:
- Poor beds
- Tiny bathroom
- Noisy corridor

Also, the door would let in a lot of corridor light at night. Quite annoying.

review.title: Friendly staff, great location....
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva is ideally located a few minutes away from Union Square; the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable, and perfect for two people travelling together. Union Square and the shops were only a few minutes walk away, making this hotel the ideal base for exploring San Francisco. We wish we had found it sooner!

review.title: Great Location for Moscone Conferences for Him and Shopping For Her
review.reviewText:
Great access to restaurants and shopping around Union Square.
Easy access to Moscone Center for a conference.

Had a great time.
Hotel was clean and quiet - no street noise or 4:00 am garabage trucks.

review.title: Ideal Location in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
