This hotel is centrally located in San Francisco. Shopping in Union Square is a couple of minutes walk away where you can also pick up the cable car, bus or a taxi. Theatres just across the street too.

Hotel staff were most helpful. Only drawback - the bathroom did not have a washbasin. This was in the room!

review.title: Highly Recommend
review.reviewText: The Diva is cute, very chic and well-kept. It is located close to many famous gastro-pubs and fine theaters. The staff know you by name because the hotel is a smaller size and the ammenities (wireless access rooms, for one) were very nice. I would choose the Diva over any other local hotel chain.

review.title: Very Noisy
review.reviewText: Extremely noisy room facing busy street. Sound sleep is tough due to significant street noise. San Fran locals (and tourists) never seem to stop creating commotion. Garbage trucks ramble at 5am... not a place for those seeking sound rest and relaxation. Certainly noise may be better away from busy street.

review.title: Do not stay here!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was short... almost rude. The room was cramped and smelled strange. The bathroom barely had room to turn around in with absolutely no counter space. The room you will get will be nothing like the pictures. The fitness "center" is super cramped and has horrible air ventilation. The only good thing about this hotel was that there was a Starbucks downstairs, AND the mexican bistro is wonderful. There is a good brunch there with bottomless mimosas.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: During my stay, I needed to scan and email some important documents. While I was in the computer room a gentleman over heard what I was trying to accomplish. So happens he was one of the maintenance people. He started to make some calls and soon I was in the corporate offices with two people helping me. Wow, great staff.

review.title: Nice Place for the Price Range
review.reviewText: A fantastic location in the heart of Union Square section of town, well within walking distance of shopping, great restaurants/cafes, and Market Street hub for catching the trolley or buses to anywhere else in the city you want to go. Upon checking in my prepaid room was not available, but I was upgraded without the bat of an eye. Nice. Keeping in mind that you are not paying an arm and a leg to stay there, I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly. The room was serviced well daily. It is smallish, but who goes to SF to sit in the room? I used the on site Fitness Center, Business Center and computer lounges. This is where I think they slip a little. In the fitness center it was hot and the air conditioner did not appear to cool sufficiently. A nice sized plasma TV, had a smashed screen. (This was taken down Saturday). The equipment was nice, 2 treadmills and an elliptical, 4-5 weight machines, free weights and a bench. The computer lounges need help. Do not put a MAC in there and then tell the user to log in using IE. They are not compatible and you get an error on 90% of any site. The monitor was up high, with a bar stool. The key board is at chin level, very uncomfortable to use. Update this area soon. The business center was much nicer was being used much more. Overall, the place could use a paint job and maybe a carpet refresher, but going back to the price, it's hard to complain about that. I would absolutely stay there again!

review.title: An okay hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and staff extremely helpful especially Conciege from NY. Room sizes are a bit small but typical of this type of hotel and no view but hey !!! We totally enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Dirty Bathroom & Camera Stolen
review.reviewText: After long drive from Los Angeles, we checked in the hotel around 8 PM. When we went into the room, the sink was dirty and there was a pool of water on the bathroom floor. I called the Housekeeping to ask them to send someone to clean it, but, they never did. We stayed in the hotel for 2 days. We assumed that they cleaned it after the first night, but, they never did!! When we returned from the full day of sightseeing, the sink was still the same and there still was a pool of water on the floor! Plus, my sister lost the camera there. It never turned up. Who would steal the camera with functions all written in Japanese?? It was a very disappointing experience.

review.title: Good place in Union Square
review.reviewText: A differente type of hotel specially the room

review.title: Doesn't quite live up to the Diva name
review.reviewText: The room had kind of a "shabby swanky" feel to it -- like maybe it was nice 5 years ago but it now seems a bit worn around the edges. We had asked for a quiet room, and while it didn't have any street noise, the heater made so much noise that we couldn't run it at night. The windows leaked so much cold air that we kept the door to the bathroom (which had a window in it) closed at night so we could keep the heat in the bedroom. As far as hotels go, it got the job done, staff seemed nice, but the room wasn't anything to write home again. I don't really regret staying there but I'll stay somewhere else next time.

review.title: Want to try other hotels in SF
review.reviewText: Clean and nice but I want to try other hotels

review.title: No natural light in the room
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel, good value and in a great spot. The biggest problem is that most of the rooms look out into a small light well so there is next to none natural light coming. If this doesn't bother you, this is a great choice

review.title: Lovely boutique in the city centre!
review.reviewText: Brilliant place, tiny but with sufficient amenities! Lovely staffs with willingness of providing tourist information and some casual talks. Stylish interior layouts and services provided really offer this hotel as such a bargain for young casual/business travelers. Ideally located on Geary street, 3 blocks away from Union Square. Ample amount of choices ranging from grab-a-bite fastfood to authentic asian food~

review.title: perfect place
review.reviewText: The Diva was the perfect place for my business stay, inexpensive, clean, hip, close to everything, the only thing I regret is not having time for a margarita next door...

review.title: Hotel Diva San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was a good find. Although the rooms are the typical small San Francisco style old hotel size, that's where any similarity to an older hotel stops. The rooms are clean, fun and contemporary. The staff was extremely helpful. Having a Starbucks accessible from the lobby was a life-saver for my wife. A block and a half from Union Square and a 7 minute walk to Moscone Center makes the location perfect for business or pleasure. A friend who was attending the same conference stayed with his family in the "kids suite". He said his kids were having a ball there.

review.title: Great value with a hip style
review.reviewText: The room was surprisingly spacious compared to similarly valued rooms in NYC. The location is great for attending the convention center and site seeing.

review.title: Price is right
review.reviewText: Good location near Union square. Comfortable beds.

review.title: we loved it
review.reviewText: This hotel was close to Union Square, cable cars, subway and street cars, museums, shopping. Front desk staff was very helpful with directions for public transportation. Room was very comfortable. Nice to have that iPod dock in the room. Cute mini lounge on almost every floor - really creative interior design.

review.title: The Best Yet in Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel was excellent. Shopping, restraunts, bars, everything was within walking distance. The staff was very helpful and the room was excellent.

review.title: Fun Fun
review.reviewText: We were "on the cheap" so the hotel room was one of the smaller ones: compact, clean, fun decor with character, and convenient. Staff was friendly and responsive. It was all we needed for a three day blast into town with very little time spent in the hotel!

review.title: would stay there again
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. the room was very clean, the bathroom a little small but certainly adequate. Loved the clean lines of the furnishings. Could not ask for a better location.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: What a cute place. The bed was so comfortable and the room was quite. I loved that the windows open to allow fresh air. The shower pressure was great. I travel a lot through my work and stay at Hiltons, Marriots, etc. This room was my favorite by far.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was old but newly refurbished - comfortable beds and thick towels. Great location - friendly staff.

review.title: Great stay, cool SF ambiance
review.reviewText: If you want a boutique feel and a great location, this is your hotel. The staff is very friendly, the amenities are great, and the price was well below what I would expect for San Francisco.

review.title: HOtel Diva Dive
review.reviewText: The hotel's rooms were extremely small. The room was not very clean, there is no restaurant on site, and the parking fee was excessive.

review.title: The floors creak, it's very small
review.reviewText: The location is one of the two things that I appreciated about this hotel. The second, the lobby was small but trendy. Other than that, I felt like I had gone to a cheap motel. I wouldn't stay there again even if they gave me a deep discount (I almost checked out without staying the night because I was so disappointed).

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at this quirky hotel.The rooms are small but very comfortable and the staff provided exceptional service whenever called upon.We liked the location and would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

review.title: Excellent hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Excellent location just off Powell street and opposite theatres.

review.title: Awesome staff, Great location!
review.reviewText: LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel. My husband and I frequent SF and always try a new hotel each time. We were so impressed with the quality of the rooms and staff that we will definitely be staying here again!

review.title: A modern take on an older hotel
review.reviewText: Like all SF hotels this is an older building but has been remodeled in a way that is fun, fresh and young. The bed was very comfortable, with verys oft sheets and a down duvet instead of gross blankets. The water pressure in the bathroom was phenomical. Water pressure and beds always get me beucase I travel so much for business and those are comforts of home that are VERY hard to find elsewhere. There was also a fridge in my room - great to store food for a businiess person who wants to be healthy and eat on their own for things like breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel in a convenient location.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. I've stayed in much better but I was satisfied with my stay at the hotel. The only thing was that the maids seemed to completely ignore the "Do not disturb" sign and come knocking and into the room every single morning. I was there for 5 or 6 days as well. Otherwise it was nice and convenient in location.

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText: Good facilities, very cozy. Bathrooms a bit small. Helpful personnel.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: I stayed one night at the Hotel Diva, it was wonderful. The internet lounges on almost every floor allowed me to leave my laptop at home, and the bussiness center even has free printing (for my boarding pass!). My only small complaint would be the street noise. If you are a senstive sleeper, you will probably have trouble. Great H2O bath ammenties and comfy beds.

review.title: If you like tiny rooms...
review.reviewText: I only stayed at this place because a fellow co-worker booked this hotel first based on a recommendation from our training facility. The rooms are the smallest I have ever been. Luckily I was only there for a week long training and stayed in the room by myself, otherwise it would be too cramped with my wife. Maybe that is the way it is in most San Fransisco hotels. The elevator usually didn't work in the mornings and I had to walk down the stairs from the 6th floor. Other than the issues I had, the hotel was in a great location, 2 blocks away from Union Square. I'll pass on this hotel next time. There are many other hotels in the area that are much nicer.

review.title: Frony Desk needs help
review.reviewText: Maid service was great.

review.title: Tiny but LOCATION!
review.reviewText: Minimalist hotel. Tiny lobby, tiny rooms, but right by Union Square. Beds were comfortable. Had an issue with the bathroom - tile needs to be replaced; shower head sprayed partly horizontal so water got on the floor. But I don't go to San Francisco to spend time in a hotel room. The hotel staff was great, especially the concierge who was not only extremely helpful but had a great sense of humor. Will probably use this hotel for future trips to San Francisco.

review.title: Not what I thought
review.reviewText: The people there were great and helpful. However I found the pictures to show the rooms as much cleaner and newer then they were. A small, old dirty building made to look new and modern without actually updating things isn't my style. If you aren't going to stay in the room other than to shower and sleep it would work nicely, but to hang out and relaxe I wouldn't suggest it. I hate to not be able to say better things about the place because the people were so wonderful, but it was a let down when I got to our room. The parking cost more daily than my rental car and that was a surprise I could have gone without. Good location if you want to be right Down Town, everything within walking distance, thats nice. Oh a good note the beds are awesome, comfy beds=good nights sleep.

review.title: Is this the noisiest hotle in San Francisco?
review.reviewText: We stayed here for three nights in September 2008. Whilst the bed was very comfortable, the room was very small and the hotel so very noisy. Being located near Union Square, we were always going to hear fire engines etc however the biggest noise came from the creaks within the hotel. We were located on the 6th floor and everytime someone on the floor above moved, the hotel would creak. This went on all through the night. We were also located near the entrance to a lounge which people would access throughout the evening. The door banged all evening. There was also no view from the window and we were also awoken with very noisy garbage collection. Great location but too noisy!

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Comfortable stay for a lower price in SF! Small rooms--but centrally located and enough of what you need. No hotel restaurant, but there is a Jack n' the Box next door!

review.title: Reasonable, great location,has some flair
review.reviewText: Small lobby, but has a nice vibe. Starbucks next door, accessible from the lobby. Great location, a block from Union Square. Nice beds, flat screen TV's. Rooms on the small side, but good value.

review.title: A place with Personality!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean, great location and very friendly staff that were very helpful. I would stay there again and hope to soon!

review.title: I'll stay here every time in SF
review.reviewText: Every detail was attended and it felt like being with old friends.

review.title: Great hotel...
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price - excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, larger rooms that are well laid out with nice features. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: The Diva was a wonderful place to stay in the city! there is close restaurants and clubs for the night life. It is a really short cab ride to all the tourist attractions. The hotel itself was clean, really comfortable and the staff was wonderful!

review.title: Very Impressed!
review.reviewText: I visit my town of birth, San Francisco twice or three times a year and I would absolutely stay at Hotel Diva again. It's two blocks from Union Square - very centrally located. The staff is super nice and very helpful - I didn't require much assistance but I overheard a number of conversations with other guests and they all seemed very happy! Hotel Diva has a number of FREE computer rooms to check email, etc. And I never had to wait! The hotel is not super LUX but everything is clean and the beds are comfortable. The decor is fresh and modern. And the price is very reasonable. I will stay there again for sure!

review.title: Trendy Little Hotel
review.reviewText: My stay at Hotel Diva was awesome. The location is perfect; right in the heart of downtown SF, walking distance to all the shopping areas and even some bars/clubs, and the price was very reasonable. The staff was very accomodating to everything i needed and I would definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends!

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice people, great design

review.title: Perfect Anniversary Weekend
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I stayed there for the weekend for our anniversary and it worked out great. It is only a block from the cable car line and lots of good shopping/touristy stuff. The hotel itself was great, they gave us a room upgrade and provided a bottle of champagne. All of the front desk staff and concierge were very helpful and full of great suggestions. Could not have asked for a better place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: it's ehhhhh.
review.reviewText: standard rooms are way to small and face brick walls. hotel is kinda old and the design is alright. staff is 50/50 good/ bad servie, with young unprofessional 20 somethings, and a few older guys who know what the term hospitality actually means. location was great, but not a very memorable hotel. next time we'll stay at a brand name hotel. at least there you know what to expect; service and hospitality. live and learn.

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: good location,most workers very polait,good coffee,internet access,very noisy rooms (from ventilators),many times they do not leave the left messagges

review.title: Would recommend to a friend anytime!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, and we were upgraded to a very spacious junior suite room. The front desk staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful with recommendations for places to go and to eat!!

review.title: Modern/Industrial Design Tastes Needed
review.reviewText: The Diva is a good establishment with a GREAT staff IMHO. However, the industrial decor is not what I am looking for when I travel. The location is perfect for those wanting to shop, attend the theater or working a show at the Moscone Center.

review.title: Slap bang in the heart of the City
review.reviewText: Hotel Diva has a personality of its own and is a great place and location to base your visit to San Francisco. Staff are very helpful and ready to advise on all manners of requests. The rooms are stylish and funky and for business travellers or for those who just have to stay in touch there are several (free) internet access points as well as a business centre.

review.title: uncomfortable beds, noisy room
review.reviewText: The first room we were given smelt really strongly of urine and was at the back of the hotel. Extremely pokey and very dark. We were not sure if the smell was inside or coming from the alley so we closed the window and went out to get something to eat. When we arrived back the odour was awful and I couldn't face sleeping in the room. So we asked to change and the reception staff was very obliging and gave us a room on the first floor directly above the starbucks and facing the main street. On first inspection it was a lot bigger and lighter without the odour so fine by me. However, every night we were woken at 3.30 am by the glass collectors directly below our window for 30mins. On closer inspection most of the fittings were falling off the walls and the bed is the most uncomfortable I have ever tried to sleep in.

review.title: Awesome Hotel!
review.reviewText: Been to SF a few times & had the opportunity to try out Diva for 2 nights. I love this hotel, the service is great & warm, the room is clean & the decor is modern clean line but not cold. The location is great too, so close to Union Sq and surrounded by restaurants & shops. I will definitely love to stay in Diva again when I return to SF.

review.title: Diva's on the D-list
review.reviewText: I got very little sleep in my room facing Geary Street due to loud traffic, carousing bar goers, and trash trucks. These rooms should get double windows or white noise machines. Front desk was unable to switch me to another room. Also, wireless access was slow and spotty (keep your dial-up account) and the toilet stopped working and couldn't be fixed as no maintenance people are on duty on the weekends. Towels were few and low-grade as well. Only thing that was decent was the gym equipment. The staff were friendly and apologetic, offering me a free bottle of wine and earplugs. Nevertheless, I will not ever stay there again as the idea of a hotel stay is to be able to rest and enjoy the location.

review.title: Nice hotel but ask for room towards back of building
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located, easy to walk to shopping,sights and restaurants. The room is very clean and decorated nicely. The bed is firm but comfortable. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The drawbacks to the hotel is the bathroom is very small. Also avoid getting a room facing Garry Street. It is very noisy at night; awaken at 4am with someone yelling on the street both mornings. And you will hear trucks driving up the street.

review.title: refreshingly different
review.reviewText: it's a hotel with a mission to be sexy. i didn't find it particularly so, but i did like the sense of personality. the room was decent, modern and appealing. no frills but a much better place than i would have expected for the very reasonable price in such a convenient part of town.

review.title: Nice, with great service. Free Internet access everywhere!
review.reviewText: Nice, modern hotel in a great location in Union Square. Parking is now 35 plus tax (Expedia site says 30). Not the biggest rooms, but adequate and good value for San Fran. Right across from theaters and just down the block from half price tixs. Plenty of restaurants and things to do within walking distance. Renovation is showing a little age. There is no DVD in the room (probably have to borrow from the front desk). Starbucks is literally right next to the hotel!

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the Union Square area, which is a perfect location for those who want to be where all the action is at night, steps from the hotel are numerous nice bars, lounges, and restaurants. It is also close to the main shopping area and close to the tourist information office and local transportation. Only complaint was that although there were lots of trendy lamps in the room the lighting was very subdued, it's hard to be a diva if you can't see to do your make-up. The rooms really do look like the photographs and the beds are very comfortable. There are internet lounges on most floors but no other amenities; however the hotel adjoins Starbucks and a lovely Mexican restaurant called Colibri, and you can enter both, from the hotel lobby. To sum it up a stylish, modern hotel, with friendly young staff, in a great location - would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Friendly service, located in a great spot
review.reviewText: We stayed there for 2 nights. The rooms for downtown SF, were comfortable, and modernly decorated. The staff was very helpful, and eager to assist. The location for new travelers visiting San Francisco couldn't be better. Right accross from 2 of SF Theaters. The public transportation was accessible. Definitely will go back!

review.title: Very budget boutique
review.reviewText: The boutique feel of this hotel ends as soon as you get on the elevator. The rooms are surprisingly small and amenities/accomodation very basic.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: Service are good. Small hotel but pretty neat.

review.title: Fine Hotel -- Lousy Internet connection
review.reviewText: Wireless internet was intermittant on good days, non-existant other times. Very frustrating for a business trip. Great people and service, if they fix the wireless service I'd be a raving fan.

review.title: Top Notch
review.reviewText: Great place to stay!! Close to Union Square and a block away from the cable cars which was great!!! Hotels hospitality was very helpful. Enjoy the Starbucks at the hotel door!!! Would recommend to just about anyone.

review.title: My regular haunt
review.reviewText: I recently moved to SF and for a few days on separate occasions on needed a place to stay so I chose Diva and was very impressed. I have stayed in a few more expensive hotels around the city, but the Diva feels a lot more 'homely'. While the building itself feels a little old, the rooms and the service are very good. There are free internet machines on some floors for those of use without laptops (there is also wifi of course), and snack machines, DVD rental, fitness room. The only downside is the slightly dodgy location west of union square, and that one of the rooms I got had a window onto the street which was not airtight, leaving a lot of street noise in. Ask for a room not facing the sreet.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location, just 2 blocks from Union Square. The Cable Car stop was right at the corner. The trolly and bus stops were within 4-5 blocks from the hotel. Gaad access to transportation. The hotel staff were excellent and helpful.

review.title: A little bit over-exaggerated
review.reviewText: I stayed in Hotel Diva for five nights in July 2006. It was easy to find and just a block and a half from Union Square. But it's just on the edge of the Tenderloin (where all the guide books tell you to stay away from). My room was really small and the window was frosted so I couldn't see outside. The concierge never seemed to be on duty so I had to ask at the front desk how to get to a tour I took one morning. They were kind of rude and threw a map at me. Also, when I checked out they had an incorrect movie charge on my bill that I had to have taken off. All in all, not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, but I wouldn't return.

review.title: It is what it is
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and modern. Our room was extremely small and right off the back fire escape. We were awoken at least four times in the middle of the night by loud guests but that's not necessarily the hotel's fault. The room and hotel worked for what we needed, a clean place to sleep, but unfortunately we didn't get much sleep.

review.title: Surprisely clean hotel for San Francisco!
review.reviewText: It was my 9th trip to San Francisco, and this is definetely the best hotel I've stayed in this city so far. Very clean, very comfortable. Next time I am staying there for sure.

review.title: would go back, very friendly hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms were very comfortable and the amenities were ideal for the 20 to 30-something clientele. However I saw families staying there as well. The gym was definitely a plus, but the internet service at the business center and the free kiosks was a little slow. There was a slight hiccup when I checked in due to an inexperienced staff member but it was cleared up quickly enough. I found the staff friendly and accomodating. I missed my flight and they were willing to accomodate me for another night at the same rate. My original room wasn't available anymore but they let me check out a couple of other rooms to make sure I found one that was to my liking. Depending on what room you get, the mirror and sink might be outside of the bathroom. Oh, their heating and air conditioning worked well, which was great since the other hotel i stay at before Hotel Diva had a system that didn't work well at all. The last night, I stayed in a room with a murphy bed, and that was fine.

review.title: A few problems
review.reviewText: This hotel was excellent friendly service at the front desk. The decor is delightful and creative. It would have been an excellent stay had it not been for a shower head that didn't work, and disruptive noise from garbage trucks in the alley. When I complained about the shower head, they eagerly moved me to a different room, but it was equally noisy. Ask for a room that is opposite from the garbage trucks!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Cool,up to date hotel.

review.title: Good hotel with great location
review.reviewText: We were somewhat disappointed that they gave us a smoking room when we requested non-smoking. The smell was bad. The staff was terrific though. Very helpful.

review.title: Great location and professional / friendly staff
review.reviewText: Located directly across from the Curran Theater, and adjacent to a great Mexican restaurant, this is a fine small hotel. The king size bed was very comfortable and the industrial (slate and stainless) room design was interesting. The windows opened which was nice, but there was no view other than the alley way. However, step outside and you're in the heart of SF.

review.title: Close to Union Square and that's it.
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to the Union Square area, good for shopping, clubbing and bar hopping, so the location is great. the Staff was mediocre and the room was a lot smaller than I anticipated. Only the decoration was modern, everything else was minimal. it looked like a trading spaces gone bad episode.

review.title: Pretty sweet
review.reviewText: Modern Decor and lighting. 3 or 4 internet rooms that you can walk into and use for free. Starbucks and a great tapas place sandwich the hotel. Dvd players and Tvs conveniently attached to the ceiling.

review.title: Good location, good service
review.reviewText: For the location and price, I definitely recommend this hotel. Also, the restaurant next door (upscale mexican bistro) is excellent.

review.title: Great Find & Great Design
review.reviewText: Some colleagues recommended this hotel to me. It's one of those great rennovated old San Francisco buildings convneiently located close to Union Square and everything else. The clever design, colors and fixtures make the modest rooms feel spacious and special. Loved the stainless steel with the minimal, bold design style - very refreshing. Loved the computer/conference rooms on several of the floors and that Starbucks is practically in the lobby.  All of the staff were extremely friendly and the whole place is wireless. And it was quiet. Perfect really.

review.title: ok for the price
review.reviewText:
Good location. Extremely friendly and helpful staff.
Bedrooms and especially bathrooms are way too small. Heating/air conditioning very noisy.

review.title: Hotel Diva-comfortable place to stay
review.reviewText: We booked a two room suite. The rooms were a little small. But they were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The price was affordable as well. Internet access free to guests. Staff very helpful. Good location a few blocks from Union Square.
